Reviews.Title: “Not my style, but new and clean”
Reviews.Author: Conniesat
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a Business trip in Chicago. This hotel was on the list of selected hotels to be used by buyers attending the Home & Housewares show, and I have stayed in Comfort Inns before, so I felt comfortable booking here. The hotel is a convenient walk to several restaurants, grocery, a Starbucks right across the street, and Bloomingdales, Nordstrums, plus several specialty stores. It was very clean and newly decorated, and I felt comfortable being a woman alone in the big city. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Now for the down side: Right next door, and in fact, adjacent to the Comfort Inn is the Tokyo Hotel. If you want a bad dream, just read Wikipedia's take on this hotel. I never saw anyone go in or out of this building, so I don't know for sure what goes on there. When I stepped into the room on the 10th floor, there was a red glow in the room, coming from the bathroom. Upon further inspection, I found a huge glowing red lipstick print on the mirror which can't be turned off. The floor is a wood laminate, the bedding is stark white, there is a huge wall hanging above the bed with a giant handprint on it, and the wall connecting the room and bathroom is covered with a giant zipper. The room can only be described as "urban ghetto". I showed the pictures to friends I took of the room, and they suggested I rent it out by the hour while I was away, and advised that if I did so, to be sure and de louse it. I normally love traveling alone for a few days, but just hours after I arrived, I was so homesick I started to cry, and tried how to fit 3 days worth of business into 1 day so I could leave that room. It was very cold and unfriendly and I did not feel welcome. Based on all this, decide what you like and make your choice to stay or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hillary677
Reviews.Content: This is just a delightful little hotel in a fabulous location. It's walking distance to super shopping (Tiffany & Co.) and fun eats (Rainforest Cafe). The staff was attentive, parking was easy, and we enjoyed the little fitness center, sauna, and hot tub in the basement. Breakfast was nice, and with a AAA discount, the price was fabulous. We would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for value, quality and location”
Reviews.Author: stella1001
Reviews.Content: You can easily find hotel rooms in Chicago but to be within 2 blocks of the Magnificent Mile with clean and pleasant rooms, a good breakfast and a price that's affordable looks too good to be true. But we had all this and excellent welcome and service too. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Merz45
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, with friendly staff and considering its central location, very reasonably priced. The hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing and shopping and our room was quiet and very comfortable. Some features were much appreciated - coffee and tea on hand in the dining room day and night; free wi-fi (though this didn't always work); real soap in our bathroom; our room was made up early (except Sunday); tea and coffee making facilities in our bedroom; and a good breakfast. What we found difficult to adjust to, coming from Germany, was the fact that all the hotel's cutlery, plates and cups were disposable, so even with some effort the amount of waste we generated just for breakfast was considerable. You evidently have to take this into account in any hotel in the US with a complimentary breakfast, but it does go against the grain for us as typical environmentally-conscious Europeans.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and very cool room!”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few years ago and loved the location and the attached parking garage, but the room was just typical. This time we had a newly decorated room that was very cool! I think we may have been the first guests since the reno as the tv still had plastic on it! The bathroom was small but had a nice tub with a rainfall shower. The neatest feature was the lighted lipstick print on the bathroom mirror. Cool and made a great nightlight! Breakfast was good and the front desk help was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: comfortgrayslake
Reviews.Content: This is an older building, which has lots of character. The hotel was just beginning to remodel when we stayed, and the remodeled rooms were not yet available. Even so, our room was in really great condition. It was spotless, though quite tiny, and everything worked properly. Breakfast was perfectly in order, and the hostess kept it running smoothly. As nice as the hotel is, the best part is the location. Right in the heart of Chicago's best dining and shopping area. And you can't beat $29 parking with in/out privileges. This gets my thumbs up, and as a manager of another hotel, I can be pretty picky.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Drapier
Reviews.Content: Third stay - very good value for a super downtown location. The rooms are large and clean and have everything one needs except, if you need it, a view. Only the front bedrooms have a view. The side rooms, where I have stayed before, have a very limited view and even in the rear room where I stayed, the sunlight never penetrates. Staff are charming, breakfasts are a good example of the typical motel breakfast, and the lobby and breakfast gallery are straight out of old Chicago - very imposing. Coffee & tea on tap, they looked after my bags, good wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Our go to place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: susanlamb76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel I can't even count how many times, at least once a year if not more. Every time I come into town I always get a room here! While it's not the fancy 5 star hotel, it's ALWAYS clean, if I ever need anything they are right at the door after I call. The front desk ROCKS-It's quick and easy to check in. The only bad thing I can say is, when trying to check in there isn't much room to "park the car with flashers on" while trying to get the keys and the parking transponder for the ramp, but really that's my ONLY issue and I don't think they can get the city of Chicago to make a bigger curb for them :)

Reviews.Title: “Best value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: rubyiu
Reviews.Content: I found this place by searching the area I wanted to stay in. For the area and quality, the price was right! I wanted to be close to Michigan Avenue, restaurants, and a subway stop. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. Check in was smooth. We came early and our room wasn't ready but they stored our luggage and got us preregistered so we could pick up our key later. The concierge went out of his way to find a restaurant that we would like and gave us a map and directions. As people mentioned, the rooms are small. We didn't care. It wasn't like we were staying in our room a lot other than to sleep and shower. It was cozy for 2 but there was a closet, luggage rack, bench and chairs to put our things on. The bathroom was nice with a very nice shower head and water pressure. The bed was comfy and so were the pillows. We stayed on the 10th floor and could hear the city traffic but it wasn't a big deal. We didn't hear our neighbors. We used the spa, which was nice! It was a larger hot tub on the lowest level and was very relaxing after a long day. The breakfast was good. The people working there were working their butts off to keep things restocked. Lots of breads/bagels/danish, yogurt, waffles, fruit, juices, eggs, sausage, cereal, milk, coffee/tea/hot cocoa and oatmeal. The eating area is tiny and many people had to sit on couches. Not very many tables but we didn't mind and still had a place to sit. We loved being just blocks from Michigan Avenue and famous restaurants like Lou Malnati's, Pizzaria Uno, Hard Rock Cafe, Rock n' Roll McDonald's, Ed Debevic's and Gino's East. Lots of selection. The subway was a block away and easy to ride to the museum campus (aquarium, field museum, planetarium). We took the train to Chicago so didn't have to pay for parking ($29 a night.. eek!) We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Suite time at the Comfort”
Reviews.Author: NPeach
Reviews.Content: Check in was flawless. Desk staff, Lora and Michelle were very polite and helpful with suggestions on places to go, things to do. Our room was spotless. General Manager Jim Harness is to be commended on such an efficient operation, two weeks before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ron R
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful, the location is great. Walk to Millenium Park, Navy Pier and all of Downtown. Adequate breakfast. The price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: restandrelax84
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in the perfect spot for restaurants, shopping and even walkable to Navy Pier. Rooms are small but comfortable, most staff are nice and the breakfast was decent enough. I'd definitely stay here again for a Chicago trip. Parking is $29 a day with in/out... but we didn't need our car since it's such a walkable town.

Reviews.Title: “William Burill is the best hotelier in the world”
Reviews.Author: jayMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gr8 and so were the people . The GM William Burill was one of the best I met in the world . Conveniently located , great prices and great service . Wish I could have stayed on longer

Reviews.Title: “excellent & clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kjd24288
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for downtown shopping and restaurants. Very nice and friendly staff. We had 1 suite room for 3 nights - the room was large and my son enjoyed the sofa bed, fridge/microwave was fine in the larger room - very good beds and up-to-date furniture and bathrooms. Excellent value for the price, strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Galapagos-Guru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort inn hotel and suites in downtown Chicago and it was super well located close to every attraction and the best restaurants in town. I could easily get around for my business purposes and of course I got to enjoy such a beautiful city in this great location. I will definitely recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Chicago. The concierge was always very helpful and gave me the right tips to where to go and how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Ro_Fr87
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience when I stayed here. All of the staff were extremely pleasant, Including Rachael at the front desk. Everyone was very helpful and the room was great! Perfect for a little getaway in the city! I had to leave early in the morning, and I was still able to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. The breakfast starts at 6 am and had a variety of options to choose from. My friend and I will definitely be back to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel544
Reviews.Content: The location was great - close to good shopping, eating, and events. Our room was very clean, bed was extremely comfortable, pillows were great. Whenever we saw any hotel personnel in the hotel, they always spoke and smiled. We had a small room, but it was perfect for us. Breakfast was included and was a good start to the day. We stayed before Christmas and noticed that a room off the breakfast area was open for gift wrapping. Paper, tape, and bows were supplied!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for downtown shopping and restaurants. Very competent and friendly staff. We had 2 rooms - different sizes and fridge/microwave only in the larger room - both rooms very clean and comfortable with very good beds and up-to-date furniture and bathrooms. Excellent value for the price, especially since breakfast is included. Completely refurbished older building - outside has character and inside is completely up-to-date (best of both worlds!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Lotionistic
Reviews.Content: Overall a great stay. We had a large room with a king, but I did sneak a peek of a smaller room (single or studio?) and it was tiny! We had plenty of room and a bar sink, fridge, and MW. The included b'fast was average, just like any other "free" hotel b'fast. The lobby was large, but the decor was mismatched - Tudor and Asian. Not that anyone cares, but it was odd. We walked to everything from the hotel and the price was great. The only negative was there was a strong sewer smell right outside of the hotel. After a long day out, we knew we were close to home b/c we smelled it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good location.”
Reviews.Author: paudbrowne
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights here for the Chicago Marathon in October. I found it a nice hotel in an excellent location 2 blocks from Michigan Ave and the Magnificent Mile shopping area. Good location fro exploring Chicago on foot also. The subway station is Just around the corner, 7 day pass cost 23$and is a great way of getting around, you can also use it on buses. My room was a nice size on the 12th floor only negative about it was the window looks into a multistorey car park and very little day light came into the room. Free internet access. The breakfast was good and the staff friendly. I only major complaint is the price they charged me. $1160 for 6 nights, 6 night in December cost $662! at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FC2010
Reviews.Content: Location A really good location which made Chicago very walkable. Room Basic and functional Staff Cold and distant

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating Staff & nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sdchron
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Comfort Inn. This was our first visit to Chicago and we arrived earlier than expected. The staff was very accomodating, allowing us to check in early. The room was nice, clean and comfortable at a great location and affordably priced. The breakfast was a very nice surprise, much better than I have experienced in other hotels. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First class property at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: hazelhazel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night long weekend stay here and it was just perfect. This was our first time to Chicago, so we wanted to be downtown, but not in the too-commercial area, which is overpriced anyway. We got a great AARP rate, and they let us check in early as we arrived at about 6am, right in time for their free breakfast. Above average hot breakfast, which included a make-your-own waffle station. Perfect! We certainly filled up each morning before heading out to explore the city. The room (I think was a suite) was perfect, big comfortable bed, microwave/fridge, "working" internet (I say this because some hotels' included internet can often be a pain in the butt....!), spotlessly clean, two TVs, plenty of space for everything we brought. We even enjoyed the 24-hour complimentary coffee and the hot tub/sauna in their fitness area. Best thing about the hotel? The location. A couple of minutes from Michigan Avenue in one direction, a block from a supermarket, (always a good plus when traveling), and in the other directions just great areas to explore. If we come again to Chicago, I'm pretty sure we'd look into staying at this property again. If they would only build a roof-top swimming pool, then I'd probably rent the room by the year!

Reviews.Title: “A fine location, comfortable accommodation, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: JerseyObserver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days a the the Comfort Inn in mid-September and liked almost everything about it. We were in a so-called "queen room" for two nights, and it was cramped--acceptable for one person, but not for two. It was, however, the room we reserved through a travel website, so we can't complain too much. The hotel staff, from the people behind the front desk to the people who made up the room, were universally friendly and efficient. My wife sometimes needs a wheelchair, and the hotel provided us with the name of a rental agency that delivered the chair before we arrived and picked it up after we left. For the last three days, we were transferred to a king room--an excellent accommodation--at a small increase in cost. It had a refrigerator, microwave oven, and kitchen sink. The kingsize bed was comfortable, the room airy and bright. The inn also provides a buffet breakfast. We went for the Art Insititute, about a mile away, and Wrigley Field, accessible by subway, the stop a block from the hotel. We enjoyed Chicago, and the Comfort Inn downtown is one of the reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the city, tiny room, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: marathon308
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in River North, about 5 walking blocks from DuSable bridge with plenty of Pizzerias and Starbucks around it. The Bloomingdale mentioned (in a review bellow) is a huge nice store for house stuff only. It is quite a neat location, however closer to the river maybe a lot more expensive. We ordered a room facing the street. One get used to the often heard sirens of fire fighter vehicles. The room was compact (like many hotels in the heart of a mega city). Internet quality was good (a cable connection in the room, Wifi in the lobby), TV set was old but it did not bother us. 2 armchairs, a bench and a small desk. Breakfast was common, eating space is small. Parking is expensive, so if arriving by a rental car, it is better to plan to return it just after check in (i.e. park in front of the hotel, use flashing lights for 15 minutes, check in and unload the luggage, then drive to nearby rental office). All major rental companies has a downtown office within a 0.7 mile nice easy walking. Our reservation was made through a conference office, 2 months in advance, price (133 $) was significantly lower than nearby locations or a regular daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborBill
Reviews.Content: My company recently booked several rooms at this location as a part of a trade show. We were extremely pleased with the size and cleanliness of the rooms, the friendly and helpful front desk staff and the great continental breakfast provided by the hotel. This is definately the best value in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Cinderbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night but we are picky about location and cleanliness. We had a very clean room and it was close to everything one would want to see in do with only 24 hours in Chicago. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location”
Reviews.Author: WayneJV
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a location near almost every place we needed to get to. The trains and buses were also nearby. The breakfast was good and had a great deal of variety. The room was relatively small but since we were out most of the time that was not a big deal. Since the hotel is sandwiched between 2 other buildings most rooms did not have a good view. Our room looked out to 2 brick walls. The cleaning crew sometimes did not complete all of the work that was needed (2 of the 6 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: WeaponH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit smaller than typical hotel rooms but that was not too much of a burden. It is right around the corner from the subway which was very convenient and also a short walk to Navy Pier. Definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a downtown location that is fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: Whiskeychick
Reviews.Content: We found this Comfort Inn to be an excellent value in an amazing location. Just one block from Michigan Ave, we walked everywhere we had to go. The room was small, but comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Enjoyed our stay and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel Located in the Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: willums
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The queen room was small and the window looked onto an alley/courtyard so there wasn't much daylight. But if you're like us and only use your room for sleeping it was fine. The room was also quiet even though we were next to the elevators. The free breakfast selection was good, including hot foods and waffles. :) The hotel was also very close to the subway and major bus stops. And they had a luggage room for before check-in and after check-out. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dave_weekleytravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed two nice days exploring Chicago. We picked this property because it was very close to the Red Line train. Easy to get here from Midway, about 50 min. Easy to ride to Wrigley Field too. Also, a couple of blocks from the Magnificent Mile. Perfect location. Bought CTA bus/train day passes in advance and they were mailed free to me. First impression - clean. Very helpful and friendly staff. We came in early and were able to check our bags in a locked area. Our room was clean, decent size and nicely appointed. Wish they didn't use flourescent lights in the bath, could be a bit brighter but was adequate. Room had a safe, microwave, small frig, good size tv, free coffee with coffee maker, large closet, wifi, hardwire hookup, good a/c, quiet, nice mattress. Room was clean! Breakfast was great! As the good word is spread the crowd gets bigger and seating was usually full but folks ate and left so others may sit. The manager says that renovation is coming soon and by early-summer 2012 that should help the seating. But the food choices were abundant and plenty of it. Two staff were working hard to make everyone happy plus keeping the food areas clean. Just awesome! Thanks gals! Bottom line - we'll be back and I'll recommend this property to my clients. Try a Segway tour from Absolutely Chicago Segway. Great people plus a fun, informative and lengthy tour for a good price. Company color is orange so look for the orange shirts. Literature in the Comfort Inn & Suites lobby in the bottom left corner of the rack. Dave G - travel agent

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: kOps210
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times. The suites have a lot of space, and they're very clean. The location is great, a couple blocks from the Magnificent Mile and a block from a subway stop. The staff was very friendly when we checked in and did some room switching so we could check in early (thanks Sandra!). Being a Sunday night, the value we received was exceptional. (Weekends are a bit higher). The spa in the basement is a little dungeon-esque, and has a bit of a mildewy odor, but it is quite relaxing! We're hoping they upgrade to Wifi in rooms soon; we're attached to an Ethernet cable right now. The TVs' could also be updated, fixing the HBO. Breakfast is breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: scientifics
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisior and then found a coupon on the hotels website for a great rate for a three night stay. We arrived a few minutes after check-in time and the manager asked us if we would like to wait for a room with a better view. We said sure so they stored our bags and went to park our car and were back 10 minutes later. At that time the manager had gotten us a room with a great view! The room was excellent and cozy...perfect for us. Parking is only $29/night (a bargain for Chicago) and breakfast is included with the room. Amazing location as well...we were able to walk to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deb Z
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for 4 day family trip and wanted an affordable place to stay. This hotel not only affordable but centrally located to all major attractions. Only 2 blocks away from Michigan Ave and an easy bus ride to museums, zoo, Willis tower, and Navy Pier. Downtown parking only $29 a day(cheap for downtown hotels) but never needed to get the car out. Yes, the hotel is a little older but clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and special thanks to Carl who was very helpful in finding restaurants and public transportation. The hotel also offers free breakfast, which was nice when trying to watch the budget. Overall, I'd come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff - we will stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: partyfamily
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable hotel to bring our kids to Chicago because it was close to Water Tower Place (American Girl, Lego store) and less than a mile to Navy Pier and Willis tower (Sears tower). Very clean hotel with mini fridge, microwave and mini sink area. Hot Breakfast consisted of waffles, eggs, bacon, muffins, etc. Parking was much cheaper than at most hotels. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and will certainly be coming back and staying at this location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “compact, clean rooms in nice location "close" to hubbub”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed this hotel ok. i was here for business and was able to reserve the room via accrued hotel points. That being said, i stayed here because i read suites in the hotel title and assumed i would have a small suite. perhaps that is available for a premium cost, i didnt enquire with the staff to find out. I found the room to be quite small - it was ok for me as a single, would be a challenge for 2 or more. the room layout was cramped - desk right next to door, big tv cabinet next to that, etc. just felt cramped. the room was very clean and the check in staff was very nice and friendly. this is a convenient location to the loop, mag mile, millennium park, etc. short walk to most of that, and not far from trains, etc. lot of restaurants in the area as well. overall thought it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sonia1972
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel from August 2-5 2011. The location was great and the staff were friendly. The breakfast had a selection of waffles, eggs and bacon as well as toast, fruit and muffins.The hotel room was clean and had a great view. There are many restaurants around but I would not recommend eating at Pizzeria Uno's next door. I did not find the deep dish pizza tasty. The transit system is right there which made it easy to travel. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Millenium Park which is worthwhile to see. Girodanos Pizzaria near the park was worth the 45 minute wait. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MeganD14
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location; we walked every where! The rooms are a little small, but well kept and the bathrooms are nice. We enjoyed the free breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “we had a good stay - great service and good value - a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Summer5
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel and would stay here again. This hotel is good value and close to everything. The hotel is hard to find at first as the sign above the entrance is not that obvious in day light. As recommended, we stopped in front of the hotel, one of us ran in and got the parking garage transponder. When we got back to the front desk we couldn't fully register because their computer system was froze up. The receptionist took us up to our room and later brought up the key cards. Our ninth floor room was small but with a great view of the Hancock building. Room faced the street but the traffic noise was never a problem. Room was kept clean. We forgot to close the safe one day and not one thing was taken. The toilet plugged up one morning but was fixed by the time we got back later that day. This hotel is conveniently located. We walked or took buses everywhere we wanted to go. There are many restaurants in the area. The streets were full of people - tourist, like ourselves, and people going to/from work. We felt safe walking the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ts846
Reviews.Content: I have stayed four times in this hotel. I have always found the hotel staff to be friendly. The rooms are neat and adequate. Complimentary breakfast is very good. I find the location to very convenient for shopping and eating out. There is a small fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LGoehle
Reviews.Content: For the price, a good place to stay in the heart of Chicago. Few blocks to the shoreline, great shopping and musuems in the area. The rooms are small and reminded me of the size you often see in European hotels. The room included one occassional chair, a desk and chair, wardrobe, queen bed and TV. The bed is very comfortable, with soft pillows. The TV is older model- so no HD or flat screen. There is not wireless in the room, so need to use your USB port. The hotel had a small work out room and laundry, which would be handy if staying for a few days. There is no restaraunt in the hotel, but several options from low to high price in the immediate area. Parking was $27/night which was lower than the other garages in the area. The catch is that you are given a control to let you out of the garage- and then have to drive around the block to return the remote to the desk. Breakfast is a typical pre-packaged continental offering breads, cereals, fruit and juices. Not so good: Young reception staff in the evening and night, who in my opinion have not learned what customer service means. The walls are thin- you hear alot of the hallway traffic. I had reserved a queen bed corner room, figuring it might be a little smaller but a corner room would have less traffic and maybe be quieter. However, I was not booked into the corner room and still given the queen bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SereneRockville_MD
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent - just a few blocks from Millennium Park and from the docks for the architecture boat tour. We hosted some friends in the evening, and the living room/kitchen set-up is ideal for that. - the fridge was large enough to hold a catered fruit platter and drinks, and the staff were very helpful, and brought us extra chairs. The doorman and front desk staff were very friendly. The bed was very comfortable. This was our second stay here, and we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable, convenient & quiet!”
Reviews.Author: LJinWA
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a nicer place. We asked for a different room & were accommodated in a prompt & friendly manner by Laura at the front desk. Breakfasts were great every morning, the hot tub & sauna area clean & well maintained. Place was convenient to everything so didn't need to rent a car. Took blue line from o'Hare then red line to Grand. About a 1 block walk from there. When we checked out our flight wasn't for several hours & they stored our luggage to give us a few extra hours of sightseeing. We are coming back to this little jewel on Ohio Street.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: nymx5793
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a couple nights in June 2011. Overall a very nice hotel and a great stay. Its a very well maintained Comfort Inn. PROS Price Location: Downtown ChiTown location CANNOT be beat. Within walking distance of the stores, buildings, Navy Pier Park, and the water. Awesome! Rooms: On the average to smaller side but everything was new. New tv, new carpeting, new bathrooms, etc. Very nice. Breakfast: Had eggs, sausage or bacon, pastries, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, juices and coffee. Oh, and it's free. Staff: Overall staff was pleasant especially the woman at the breakfast area. Free wifi CONS Housekeeping is a bit sluggish My view was: on one side a ventilation shaft, the other side a parking garage. Was not a big deal to me though. I had a great stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum070
Reviews.Content: If you need or want to stay in the River North area of Chicago, then look no further. Great rooms that are clean, great location, (walk to the Pier), and affordable! Staff is excellent in all respects and the breakfast is great, (waffles tooo!). Parking is extra but expected and reasonable. Right on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenM
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel on Expedia and found it to be a good hotel with pleasant, helpful staff. I lost my wallet on the train in from the airport and the receptionist (Michelle?) was helpful in getting me checked in without a credit card so I could get to a phone and cancel credit cards etc. My room was comfortable and kept clean throughout my stay (12 nights). The complimentary breakfast is a fine start to the day but can get crowded at times. Free internet access is available in bedrooms. The hotel is one block from the Grand Red Line El station which is great for a cheap means of getting in from the airport. The central location is close to Michigan Ave shopping and surrounded by many restaurants and bars. The Loop, Millennium Park, Grant Park & the Art Institute are walkable in 10 - 20 minutes. And many attractions can be reached by a relatively short walk or short El ride. I have stayed in this hotel before (2005) and would not hesitate to stay again when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry”
Reviews.Author: tyhoon
Reviews.Content: Roomm wa dark and narrow. Brekfast was minimum selection with limited number of table seats. It was my first experience to have something on my knees in the hotel. Furthermore,my room was not cleaned until my claim call at 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: stephmark08
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, a little noisy at night but it is in a major city so you should expect noise. The room we had (room 303) had a big front window that was over the street and could be opened. It was a small room but clean... had a suprisingly good free breakfast every morning with muffins, cereal, toast, waffle iron so you could make your own waffels, eggs and meats, even mini yogurts. The juices were kept full and coffee was out 24 hours. Service was good. As for location it is 3 blocks from Michigan Ave and you are surrounded by restaurants and bars, from pizza to 5 star steaks to great dive bars with some fantastic food. The Red Line 'L' entrance is about 3 blocks away, and there was a bus stop right on Michigan Ave. We walked EVERYWHERE, and we felt safe all night. Chicago is a huge city and I would DEFINATELY stay here again, not a five star hotel but it is clean and conviniently located to everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly staff and excellent downtown location makes this a winner”
Reviews.Author: littlewolf1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a double queen size suite. The room was very nice & clean. The beds were very comfortable. The entire hotel staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, was cheerful and friendly. The breakfast was fresh, tasty and well staffed. The parking garage is convenient and secure. This downtown location puts you right in the middle of Chicago and it's many great restaurants and tourist destinations. It's also close to a great jazz & blues record store and an awesome book store. I look forward to making this my home away from home on my return trip to the Windy City. Be sure to check out the manager's special - I got free parking by just showing my Cubs tickets when I checked in after booking directly with the hotel. Also, the sauna and whirlpool were fantastic as was the workout room. Thanks again to the entire staff for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smilinglady13
Reviews.Content: The moment I showed up at the hotel exhausted from my trip there until I checked out, I received absolutely wonderful treatment. I especially enjoyed the lady that kept the breakfast area filled with food. She also had a pleasant comment and a nice smile. My stay was a week long, never a mean or grumpy look. I also liked the front desk people as they were very helpful to me. I had never stayed in Chicago before and did not have a car. By their help I was able to see all the items I had on my "must do' list. I will certainly be returning to visit Chicago and staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: ladybeetle
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during recent restaurant convention at McCormick Center. Not a very pricey hotel. My room was not big at all as some reviews said, I had a single, queen bed and small room, but clean. Room faced the front on the third floor. That was great for people watching but kind of noisy. Windows did open. I think drivers in Chicago need to honk their horns a lot. I could walk up and down steps no need to wait for elevator. Beds are middle of the road OK. Great location near Michigan Avenue and blocks from the river. It's not a bad walk to go across the river to Millinium and Grant parks, etc. If you get tired of walking you can cab back for about $10. Great restaurants and grocery/deli very near by. Around the corner from Nordstrom and other shopping. No pool, but OK hot tub, could have been hotter but had nice jets. Served continental breakfast in morning in which one could make their own breakfast sandwich, or make a waffle along with a donut/pastry and juice bar. Great coffee. Staff helpful and friendly. Parking is right next door, but the pedestrian exit is on Grand Ave so you have to walk around the block with your luggage. So if you are going with someone else drop them and the luggage first, then go park. I would map this or any location on mapquest and pull up shopping, restaurants and other items around it. I will stay here again next year for the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great City!”
Reviews.Author: passionate-gardener
Reviews.Content: I was with a Road Scholar tour and everything was terrific! The staff was helpful and courteous. The room was clean and quiet. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Big Value in a Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DisIllusioneD_52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a heritage building just minutes on foot from the Magnificent Mile. The interior has been very nicely upgraded and belies the age of the building. The rooms are well-appointed and scrupulously clean. In fact, each room includes a fridge and a mini-microwave! Every member of the staff I came in contact with was unfailingly polite and helpful, especially Karl, the doorman/concierge. The continental breakfast includes a good variety of choices and is available for most of the morning. I didn't have occasion to use the onsite laundry facilities but knowing they were there was very reassuring. The room rate is reasonable, considering the location and amenities and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable place in a big city”
Reviews.Author: JLB63
Reviews.Content: A nice surprise. Room nice and big. Even thought I used points, The rack rate was around 1/2 of what my friends were paying downtown and they had a very small room. Would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: moparallen
Reviews.Content: Do you stay in a Hotel in Chicago for the view or the location? Yes I was also looking at the wall, but I wasn't there to see the city from my room window! We were able to walk everywhere we wanted, see everything we wanted, do just about everything we wanted. Flew into Midway, rode the Orange line to Roosevelt then changed to the Redline. Went straight to the hotel with no problems. I stayed 2 nights on seperate nights. Rooms were fine for the two of us. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The workout center was better than many I have used at places that were way more expensive. I will be back.... The only negative was having to walk up 14 flights of stairs when the elevator was out. It was a weekend and it did take a while to get it fixed but the staff was trying hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “great location and Price”
Reviews.Author: julie_r04
Reviews.Content: The Hotel have a great location,,Clean , comfortable and the staff very cordially and friendly.The hotel is near the red line train and the Bus Stops. Near Magnificient Mile and interest points. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: rrmz
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for the Chicago area, well located, mantained and accesible, will certainly be my first choice for next visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, superb staff, clean comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Boss48322
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location in Downtown Chicago. Parking is a breeze as the parking is located right next to the hotel. The hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. I needed directions on two occassions from two different desk personel and both times the interation was courteous and patient. The rate was reasonable and this hotel includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything you need at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ewachs
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my husband and our toddler (under 2). The hotel is in a great location, quite accessible to the magnificent mile and the bus (I believe close to the train/subway as well but we didn't use it). We went to the Field Museum by bus and walked back (a longish walk) and also walked to the area of the Art Institute of Chicago. The breakfast is basic but perfect for families. No complaints, I just don't know how it would be with two small children because the rooms are small so two cribs or even one cot would not fit.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: narimasu70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, has a great complimentary breakfast to start your day off, and the rates were very low for downtown Chicago. The staff was very helpful and eager to direct. The only negative I have for this hotel is that we reserved a room with a living area attached, so that we could have a meeting area for conversations and planning, This had to be the most uncomfortable sofa ever designed.By the end of our time, most of us were sitting on the floor. Make sure to take the self park option if you're driving. They give you a transmitter to enter and leave the parking garage whenever you wish. It's also cheaper than valet parking and I beleive, a lot quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Price”
Reviews.Author: nixtravelz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a room with a single queen bed. The reviews are correct in that this is a very small room and the views out the window are of the dirty building next door. However, the hotel is very clean and I found the staff to be very nice and helpful, the price was great and you couldn't beat the location. Two other couples joined us for the weekend and found the accommodations to their liking as well. It was also very close to the subway system. One hint to travelers visiting for the first time...bring a map of the subway (including the loop). Fortunately, I brought one, otherwise we would have been lost! Make sure to check out Gino's East Pizza and Garret Popcorn while visiting. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and good price”
Reviews.Author: rbt226
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on St. Patricks day weekend and was packed downtown. The Hotel staff was good but not great. Im sure they were just busy with it being St. patricks day weekend. We had a non smoking room and it faced "The Wall" everyone talkes about. Not a huge deal since we were not in the room very often. The rooms were small but not to the point of it being to cramped. Our reservation was for a queen bed but it was only a full size bed. The bathrooms were very nice and up to date and good size. Overall great location and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel for travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: tomcunniffe
Reviews.Content: Many travelers have contributed positive reviews of this hotel, and I agree with them completely. The rooms are small, but adequate; window views are not great, but the staff is very helpful and the location can't be beat. What amazed me most was the vending machines. How many times have you found a hotel's soda or snack machine with prices 2 or 3 times higher than on the street? Not here! Prices are EXACTLY what you would find outside the hotel. Plus, they provide a washer and dryer so you can do your own laundry at a buck per load! High time that a hotel treated their customers with respect. One warning: after getting used to having fresh waffles every morning (a major part of the continental breakfast), you'll want to buy your own flip-type waffle maker when you get home!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, comfy. Great location with excellent amenities nearby.”
Reviews.Author: therewasthisonetime
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want a cheap, clean and comfortable room just North or the Loop district. The room itself was not the largest, but had a huge, comfortable bed, coffee making facilities and a good bathroom with shower. The breakfast nothing fancy, but still good, bagels, muffins, pancakes etc, all limitless. Location is excellent, loads of bars, cafe's, restaurants within 10 minutes walk, excellent connections downtown or uptown to the best Jazz and comedy clubs. There is free internet in all rooms, or if you don't have a laptop a computer in the lobby with free access. The only thing that I didn't like is that I had to leave.....

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: robertsjs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and convenient to all of downtown Chicago. The Red Line is just a block or so away and Michigan Avenue is a short walk. There are numerous restaurants nearby including some of the famous pizza places that are worth the visit. The hotel room was pretty small compared to most but we didn't really spend that much time there other than to sleep. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the room was very clean. The continental breakfast was very good and added extra value to the price. There was the normal cereal, do it yourself waffles, pastries, bagels, fruit, and several drink choices. This is a really good value and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with superior value”
Reviews.Author: Familyman54
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, food, and theaters. We walked to most of our sites. Suite worked well for our family of 4 with sitting area with second TV and wet bar. Good free breakfast with make your own waffle iron, juices, cereal, muffins. 24 hour coffee and in/out parking. Great Deal $$$. Stayed over Christmas; even had free giftwrapping room. We made use of the small fridge and microwave and the market next door. Staff was excellent! Fast, free internet right in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price-small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ntlwhlr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while sightseeing and Christmas shopping downtown. Our stay here was decent. 1. Price - we booked right on the hotel website for $76/night for a queen bed room. Can't beat that price downtown with a location like this. 2. Clean - the hotel common areas and our room was clean and everything worked well. 3. Location - we were within short walking distance of most things downtown (tons of shopping and places to eat) and if you parked at the hotel there was a free trolley to a bit more distant place such as Navy Pier. 4. Free breakfast was decent-only hot item was waffles, toast or bagels but they also had fruits, cereal, pastries, juices, etc. Not bad for free. 5. The room we had standard queen room is quite small. There was room for the bed, 1 chair and a small desk. 2 people do max out this room or 2 and a child in a small crib. Overall, a good stay and we would stay here again if we wanted stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very convienent location, walls a little thin though.”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0216
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the rate was good for what we wanted. We arrived before the 3:00 check in time and they had a room ready! We were able to check in and relax before heading out shopping. The room was small but okay for a 1 night stay, it was clean and smelled good too. The only complaint we had was the people in the room next to us were loud and sounded like they were in our room. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were really soft almost too soft but nice. The next day when we checked out they held our luggage for us until we were ready to leave so we were able to do some more shopping without carrying around a suitcase and other stuff. The hotel staff was very nice and they made us feel welcome. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: magicdiz
Reviews.Content: good location, near some delicious restaurants. Grand El Train stop on the Red Line is around the corner of the building. our room was small, but clean and organized: queen bed, two end tables, foot rest, leisure chair, desk, computer chair, and tv cabinet unit. the view however was another building, but we didnt care. we don't go to big cities to look out the window all day! concierge was very nice and informative. breakfast on the 2nd floor was great: bagels, do-it-yourself waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, muffins, pastries, coffee, juice, hot cocoa, ect.... PARKING: Parking goes as follows: first you park your car with the emergency lights on in the street in front of the hotel. run in to check in, the gal will give you a little plastic case with a built in sensor to place on the dash of your car. the sensor automatically opens the gate to the parking garage. the public parking garage, that has 3 different entrances around the block. one is about 20 feet from the hotel doorway on Ohio St., or one around the block on Wabash Ave., and one on Grand Ave. (doesnt matter which you enter with). Then when you are ready to check out of your hotel, leave the sensor on the dash until you get out of the parking garage, park it in front of the hotel with the emergency lights on again, run in to hand it over. the fee for parking is $25 with in/out priveleges (just leave that sensor on the dash to "remote" open the gate so you can come and go as you like). if after you've checked out of your room, you want to stick around in Chicago longer than 12:00pm check out time without dealing with where to put the car, they can let you keep your car there for another $10 until no later than 5pm. so we did that. it allowed us to take the train to some shopping areas without worrying about the car. hope that didnt sound too complicated!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: macndave
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Weber Grill restaurant adjacent. Convenient for my meetings. Really decent rate. Nice size room with appliances. On the other hand very smoky smelling. Noisy AC unit. Clerk seemed put out that I needed receipts for all 3 of our rooms at check out and the printer was acting up. Overall positive experience. Would stay again at the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: WoodbridgeVA
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is truly outstanding. I was combining business with pleasure which meant that part of the trip was on expense account and part on my personal dime. I have had difficulty in the past with hotels splitting reservations and not uncommonly have had to change rooms. This did not happen here. I was able to make two separate reservations, called the hotel in advance and they prepared separate paperwork while keeping me in the same room. When I arrived early on the first day, the front desk staff reviewed my reservation, put my luggage in storage and provided precise directions to my business meeting. The WiFi in the lobby was down but two employees dropped what they were doing and reset the router in a matter of minutes so I could check my email. Throughout my stay, all of the staff went out of their way to be helpful and responsive. Two negatives, one minor and one major. The room included a work table and two padded chairs designed more for watching TV than working at a desk. A straight back work chair would have been more useful since the arms of the padded chairs would not fit under the desk. More importantly, there was some sort of construction going on behind the hotel and trucks were going in and out all night (except Friday/Saturday). This was a real problem when the trucks went into reverse and put on their back-up horns at 3:00 am. I mentioned this to the front desk and suggested they install noise dampening curtains until the construction was finished. When I return, and I will but when Chicago is not quite so cold, I will ask for a room away from the back and probably raise my rating of the sleep quality. Location could not be better. Three blocks to Michigan Ave. Six to Navy Pier. About half a mile to the Art Institute. Easy walk to both Hancock and Sears (now Willis) towers.

Reviews.Title: “good spacious well located”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful, there were luggage storing facilities.Lovely location and kitchen facilities avalaible.-walking distance to the river and also the magnificent mile with plenty of shopping nearby-souvenir shops adjacent and opposite to the hotel-worth going back again

Reviews.Title: “we have found our chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrali52
Reviews.Content: this was our third vacay to chicago and we have found the perfect hotel. there is not a better location...convenient to the train, the restaurant district and shopping right around the corner. it is perfect for flying in, then hit the streets running. clean rooms, clean hot tub and workout room, good breakfast and located right by a jewel/osco if you want to grab anything from deli soups to steaks to microveable items. The staff could not have been friendlier. STAY AT THIS HOTEL...you will find your perfect chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn and Suites was our home for 5 nights in Chicago in late September 2010. In my opinion, the hotel itself is a pretty standard 3 star property in terms of rooms, services, etc. However, given its excellent River North location and the fact I got a room for $100/night, I'm giving it 4 stars for overall value. Room - We were in a basic room on the 7th floor. The room was very small but manageable for two people for 5 nights. Our room only had a window into a very narrow alleyway looking out at a wall about 3 feet away. The queen bed was comfortable. There wasn't much storage space in the room, but after unpacking and placing our suitcases on top of the TV/entertainment unit, there was enough room for us to move around. Shower water pressure was good and the bathroom was a good size. Overall, the room furnishings were a little dated, but the room was clean and served its purpose. Location - Absolutely perfect for our trip. The hotel is located a 1 block walk away from the Grand El station on the red line which was perfect for getting to/from most of the sights we wanted to see. Travelling in from O'Hare on the El blue line was about 1 hour. The hotel is very close to excellent restaurants, bars and shopping. There is a grocery store across the street which came in handy for picking up snacks/drinks. I wouldn't even consider staying in another downtown Chicago area if/when I come back. Service - It was efficient but lacked any friendliness or personality. On our way out the first evening, we let the front desk know there was no TV remote in our room. When we returned after dinner, they had placed one in our room. Breakfast - It is included in the room rate and feautres pretty standard fare (bagels, toast, cereal, some muffins, juices, coffee, yogurt, apples/bananas, waffles). It was a good quick way to start the day. They use disposable plates/utensils so you can pick up some food and take it back to your room if you want. If you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room and can get this hotel for a good rate, I'd recommend staying there for the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: thetravelduck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly inexpensive considering it's location. It also included a continental breakfast which got the day started in a simple but satisfying way. I found the front desk staff just barely friendly and not very well informed - sent me jogging in a very busy pedestrian area during rush hour, said the CTA was 30 minutes to O'hare(it's actually an hour). There was always someone there and I never waited for help. They gave me a room at noon despite the posted check-in time of 3 pm. There is a single computer set-up in the lobby area for printing boarding passes, etc which I used for that purpose with no problems. The room is smallish but equipped with non-wireless free internet and free local calls, the bed is comfy with lots of pillows and the bathroom was modern, clean and had a good shower. It was quite noisy at night. I think this may be related to nearby construction as it was a load humming/droning sound that was not happening during the day and was stopped by 3 am. There was also some traffic noise but it wouldn't have bothered me except for this other problem. There are a number of good restaurants within a block or two and the red line CTA is only a block which is why I chose this spot for ease of transport to O'hare. I would stay here again but look for a room on the quieter side away from whatever is going on out there at night or confirm that the construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: LOVE-MJSTANGS
Reviews.Content: My senior mom and I stayed for 3 nights during Labour Day long weekend. Hotel is an older (European style) but very comfortable and clean. Included free breakfast. Hotel rooms had microwave and mini fridge and bar sink which is very handy. It is close walking distance to all the main stuff. Restauarants everywhere. Public transit very easy to use. Red Line (subway) around the corner of hotel and took it to Chinatown ("95th station" going and "Howard Station" return), very fast 10 min from subway station to Cermak/Chinatown stations (6 stops). If you're lucky and it is not crowded you can catch the free Trolley that runs from Navy Pier to about State Street vica-versa. The Architectural Cruise with the First Lady is recommended very good and informative. "Uno's" for deep dish pizza (long line up) and "Calfornia Pizza" are down the street have great pizzas. Only negative thing about this hotel is the old fashion small TV and no scenic view from the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort stay indeed!”
Reviews.Author: munamunir08
Reviews.Content: Great location. I stayed three nights with my husband and sister visiting us from London. The hotel was walking distance from the Mag Mile, Millenium Park & Art Institute, John Hancock Tower, Sears Tower and the Pier. How can you go wrong if it literally takes 5-10 mins walk to the city's landmark and a good breakfast inclusive of your stay? Highly recommend everyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: ellobie
Reviews.Content: I booked a block of rooms & our wedding night room four months prior to the wedding. We had about 10 rooms of people staying, though only 2 rooms booked through the block because their online deals were much better priced. When we arrived after our wedding, the front desk treated us horribly. The group sales guy had not actually made a reservation for us (even though he took all my credit card info to hold the room) and they were completely booked up. Rather than help us find a room at another hotel or do ANYTHING to help us out, the staff just told us repeatedly they didn't have a reservation for us. A friend went next door to the Embassy Suites and THEY found a room for us down the road at Hotel Indigo, where everyone treated us with the respect any person deserves. Afterward, the group sales manager ignored my phone calls and emails to find out what had happened to so royally screw up our wedding night. I finally had to reach out to the CEO of Comfort Inn to get anyone at the hotel to contact me. They did offer us a free night if I could stomach the idea of returning to their establishment. No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: lindsaylou82
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to Chicago for a mother/daughter weekend and stayed Comfort Inn and Suites Chicago. It was very well suited to what we needed, just a short walk to the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, and other attractions. There are several close restaurants as well, including Uno Pizza, yummy! The continental breakfast was good, cereal, bagels, muffins, fruits and waffles. Breakfast was very busy but staff worked hard to keep it stocked. The only thing missing for us was peanut butter...oh well! Our room was very clean, and had a separate living area with refrigerator and microwave which came in handy. Night time in the hotel could be a little noisy, but this was mostly due to normal city sounds and inconsiderate guests. The fitness center was pretty small: a bike, treadmill, elliptical and a few weights. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Carl, the bellman was especially helpful. I would stay here again if returning to the area.

Reviews.Title: “For me it was great - for the bride & groom, not so much...”
Reviews.Author: africandreams
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel several months back when I was preparing to travel to chicago for a friend's wedding. With the AAA price and the location of the hotel, it was too good to pass up. It's about a block from an L station, which is fantastic. Michigan Ave is two blocks up and Lakeshore Drive is only about a 15 minute walk. You cannot beat the location. The continental breakfast was also great - make your own waffles, bagels, juices, fruit, yogurt - a lovely start to the day. The rooms were small, but in good shape - you could tell they had been recently updated. I didn't mind the small space because I knew I really only needed the room for sleeping and showering. If you want luxurious space to hang out in - this is not the place for you. Anyway - I had a great experience, but the bride and groom whose wedding i attended were not so lucky. They had booked a block of rooms for the guests and were told a room would be held for them, too. Fast forward to the wedding night (or really, 2am the morning after the wedding), the bride & groom show up and there is no room at the Inn. Yup. The front desk staff were none too helpful - their only reaction to the situation was to put the bride on the phone with the manager. That, ummmm, did not go so well. Between the bride, groom and myself, we were able to find them another room in town, but with no credit to the help of the hotel staff. With that being said though, I am rating this on MY stay - which was lovely. My only advice - if you book a room be sure you have a reference number!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Walkthedream
Reviews.Content: I would visit Comfort Suites again in Chicago! They have the best cleaning services and the beds were like sleeping on clouds! I will recommend this inn to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip pleasure”
Reviews.Author: llovin
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn & Suites fit all of my needs perfectly. I was away from home on a business trip, so I spent a lot of time at the hotel while I was not working. Wireless internet was great, and room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JRTheChief
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently completed a 3 night stay at this property. We had stayed here a few years ago in a suite room and were pleasantly surprised. This time we stayed in a queen room with results that weren't so pleasant. It was obvious that since our last visit the hotel had done nothing in the public spaces other than basic maintenance. The carpet was worn, walls needed to be painted, furniture needed to be replaced.The queen room was small but serviceable. It's condition was OK. The regular lighting in the bathroom is poor. You should not have to turn on the heater lamp to provide illumination. The counter staff was adequate. The one staff bright spot was the bellman Carl who was very helpful and accommodating. That being said, he was only on duty the day of our arrival. This hotel is in a great location north of the river. It's a block from a red line subway stop. Unless you get a great rate at this property I'd suggest looking elsewhere for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: glowmom57
Reviews.Content: Had booked the room earlier in the year requesting early check-in. Arrived, told room wasn't ready. My daughter had to change in the bathroom to attend conference. Upon return to the hotel later in the afternoon, the room we were given was double booked. Had to wait while they moved that gentleman out and recleaned the room. Staff is indifferent. For the price charged for the room, the hotel is quite plain, the inconvenience - never stay here again. Willing to pay more for a nicer, more friendly place

Reviews.Title: “Oversold with Poor Alternative Choices”
Reviews.Author: FlyOverGuy
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 7pm to find they had oversold the hotel and that I can not have the room I reserved months in advance. The manager sends me to a new hotel I am told that is a great hotel a little north of downtown. I know the city is jammed for NEOCON, I dont expect a $500 room from the Comfort Inn but that is all that is available downtown. He does offer to pay for the new hotel and gives me $15 for my 30 minute of parking time I have now wasted. BTW - Do not take the stairs out of the garage they are sewers. This new hotel turns out to be in Lincoln Park...this is not a downtown location as I find out but 3.7 "Chicago" miles away that takes me 20 minutes to find. This new hotel has a parking garage that is so conjested they wont let you park your own car. When I ask the attendant if this is in deed the hotel parking garage he snaps back with a challenging "do you have a reservation?" Scary guy and he is NOT going to park my car. I tell him yes but I am not staying, he says good your not staying. Wierd scary dude. Anyway, my night is busted, I have missed my gathering. I drive out to the burbs and grab a nice easy in and out hotel, have dinner and drive back into the city for my conference the next day. The Comfort Inn screwed up and they ruined my evening. It is interesting they had my phone number. They could have called before I arrived. Maybe they were hoping to charge me if I didnt show. I had to agree to give them 48 hours notice if I wanted to cancel or pay them the amount of the room. Thumbs down and next year at NEOCON I'll pay a few bucks more and avoid this joint.

Reviews.Title: “great value, small room”
Reviews.Author: cowley_traveller
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay right downtown Chicago and not spend gobs of money, this place is great. Rooms though are small but clean and comfortable. We expect smaller rooms in downtown locations anyway, so we didn't feel disappointed. The hot tub was great with all kinds of jets but we had to turn on the sauna to heat it up. Breakfast is the typical Comfort Inn type but the breakfast room is quite small. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: stella1001
Reviews.Content: Perfect for shopping on North Michigan Ave (the Magnificent Mile) or getting to the major downtown sights like the Millenium Park, the Art Institute etc. Lovely hotel and very friendly staff. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: ShopNSlots
Reviews.Content: We drove into Chicago and had to call the hotel twice in order to find it! There is nothing outside to tell you where it is. It is wedged in between some other buildings and restaurants. Parking is 25$ a day with in and out privileges (thank goodness for that, but you really don't need to drive that much) but the garage has no connection to the hotel. You drive, you park, you walk out of garage and back into front of hotel. Breakfast is free and is a carb lovers delight. Cereal, pastries, waffles, milk, juice, tea and coffee (which is available 24/7). They did have boiled eggs. Our room was in back of hotel which had one window facing the parking garage and the other facing walls and the heating cooling systems. The beds were nice enough, it was great that we had a dorm size fridge and microwave in the room along with a bar sink. The room itself was a bit small and the bathroom had the TP situated where you had to reach straight behind you to get to it - poor 'product' placement. Best thing about this hotel was price we paid for it and it was walking distance to almost everything we wanted to get to. Oh and free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: lowmaintenanceBrit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while trapped by volcano. Trying not to spend too much, so was really pleased with the generous breakfast. Easy to walk to from the subway stop, so didn't need to pay for a shuttle or taxi. Free internet. Clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Location/Hotel on the Magnificant Mile”
Reviews.Author: Mizzpicky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from the 23rd of April to the 27th. I have all but good things to say. Check-in was quick, staff were extreamely freindly. Some reviews say that the rooms are small, but for a weekend getaway I couldnt ask for a bigger room, it was clean had all the basics you would need and I would say it was an average size. The location of this hotel is amazing, everything you would want to see including all the main attractions, food, shopping are right at your finger tips. We only got a cab twice and that was beacuse it was raining. Restaurants that are close by that you have to dine at are #1 Texas de Brazil( one of the coolest restaurants I ever ate at) unlimited meat!! #2 PF Changs ( really good) and Portillos is good too. There is a liquor store attaced to the hotel and there is ATM Machine inside there. I suggest using a banks atm machine to be on the safe side. Water tower is amazing for shopping and so is Felines basement (all designer stuff extreamely discounted). The hotel also has small gym with sauna and whirlpool (good way to relax after long day of walking). ok the continental breakfast is the best i ever seen. Every fruit/cereal/pastry/bagel you can imagine, make your own waffle station, bolied eggs and english muffins, every juice/milk. Perfect to start your day, we never bought breakfast once in Chicago!! Tip get the "Go Airport Express" shuttel to the hotel from Midway airport. Get the return trip, its way cheaper then a cab, approx $30.00 return versus a cab that can be $75.00 each way in traffic hour. Overall hotel is great, staff are fabulous, breakfast is great and a money saver!! stay here espicially if one a budget ( your getting a great deal)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Delilah19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 block from the red line train. (Grand stop) Lots of restaurants within a few blocks. We had a room with 1 queen bed that faced the side of another building and it was VERY quiet !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Large Room with Wet Bar”
Reviews.Author: ChattiPatti
Reviews.Content: We used our points to book this hotel for two nights during Easter week. Our room was large and had two window- not much of a view but we were on the 14th floor. Wet bar, coffee in room, microwave and minifridge plus free breakfast downstairs. Very quiet and the king sized bed was comfy with lots of pillows! Ethernet connection was great

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: StockholmBean
Reviews.Content: Great hotel experience. As all American hotels you only get sweet, white carbs for breakfast. Be careful with using the in-room entertainement system, you'll get charged without prior notification

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrEdnWilbur
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent guest of different Choice Hotels and this hotel is one of its better ones. The building is older but the interior is newer and tastefully designed. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom was immaculate. The price of the room also entitles you to a free continental type breakfast on the second floor atrium. But its biggest attraction is its location in the heart of River North at Ohio St between Wabash and State Streets. This is where the restaurants, bars and shopping are located. And two blocks away is the Magnificent Mile. Very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “good compromise”
Reviews.Author: mauhey
Reviews.Content: Well located (close to the tube but you may easily walk downtown). Safe area. More than acceptable room. Easy. Nearby big drugstore. No frills but this is how it should be

Reviews.Title: “A great deal on a great place”
Reviews.Author: brendaintulsa
Reviews.Content: I had a huge surprise walking into our room on this hotel. I haved stayed at Comfort Inns before and they always prove to be clean, and nice and always a good deal for the money however this time I was completely shocked by how nice the lobby, hallways, room and bathroom was. To top off our stay, the complimentary breakfast was extremely tasty and the front desk clerks met every need we had with a smile. I had the pleasure of speaking to the one of the managers over the phone and she likewise did everything possible to make our stay perfect. To finish off, the parking at this hotel is almost half of all other parking in the downtown area and is convient to the hotel. The hotel is a close walk to Michigan Ave. and to lots of great restaurants. So, if you are looking for a great deal is an expensive city, give the Comfort inn hotel and suites a try and ask for a king room at the end of the hallway. That is where we stayed and the room was large and perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Busily_retired
Reviews.Content: Room very comfortable (esp. after long flight). Reception staff most helpful to 2 strangers to Chicago, and breakfast bar excellent. Easy walking distance or public transport to everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: greenbackpack33
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid it was an excellent stay -- 3 nights in Chicago. The room was a good size, the check-in staff was courteous and very nice, but the check-out staff was rude and unfriendly. Parking with in and out privileges were $25/night which is unheard of in the city. Definitely will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, rude check out agent”
Reviews.Author: seattle_wannabe
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel located in a very nice spot in downtown chicago. enjoyed the stay, smaller rooms but clean and with a european feel to it. breakfast was good. No wifi at rooms only in the 1st and 2nd floors, where the dining room is. and beware of the check out agent S., she might try to rip you off by charging you $10, just because you chekced out 25 min late! she won't even notify you! read your receipt carefully before signing!!

Reviews.Title: “rip off on a good location”
Reviews.Author: heiwe189
Reviews.Content: Good location, but the parking prices are ridiculous and don't try to ask for favors on late check-out they steal another $20 for that and damn you if you don't get the car transponder back to them - another $75 threat. you pay for the day but you better get out of that garage before 12... after almost a week of staying there one would expect they would offer some niceties like an easy late checkout or some extended parking - wrong guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: af01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights when visiting Chicago. The hotel is located just 10-15 minutes walking from the loop, and you can walk anywhere in downtown if your up for it. In the area around the hotel there are lots of good restaurants. We booked a queen room, the room is small and crampy. It is sort of long and not very wide, and then cramped with furniture making it kind of an annoyance when you have to move your suitcases all the time to pass through the room. For a longer stay, i think i would go crazy with annoyance. The free breakfast was good and very standard, including a waffle bar which is nice. All in all the hotel offered a great value for money, we payed about half of other hotels in the same area. But it comes for a price, the rooms are small and you do have to walk 10-15 minutes for the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelergirl
Reviews.Content: First of all, if all you are looking for is location and a parking/internet bargin, I would suggest this hotel. Otherwise, forget it. I had a single queen room and it was tiny. There was barely any space to sit, except for the bed and at the tiny desk for a computer. The internet access is free-but it's hardwired and very slow. I tested the connection and it's capable of higher speeds, but they limit the speeds to a crawl. Not worth the hassle, even for free. There is not a fridge or microwave. The customer service is horrible. They forgot to clean my room and then admonished me when I asked for towels, tissues, etc when I returned to the hotel at midnight. I wasn't told upon arrival that it's good to unload before parking in the lot, so I assumed that the lot was connected to the hotel. I wound up dragging my luggage around the block, in front of the Pizzaria Uno and into the street (due to construction) in order to get into the hotel. And honestly, out of any dozens of hotels I've ever stayed at, this bed was the most uncomfortable. It was incredibly hard and the pillows were flat. My husband and I left with sore bodies and necks (and exhaustion from being unable to sleep) for two days. I just cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: melancholymarie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but the bedspread was not the prettiest. Just cosmetics though -- form follows function and this room functioned. I had room 701 and it was a good location --the window faced ohio street and there was just one room caddy corner to us noise level was very low -- even street noise. The bathoom was spick and span. Shiney tiles lined the shower wall and ceramic tile on the floor. Granite counter top/sink area. Bed was very comfortable and had a thin blanket in betwen the sheets ('cause I kick the comforter off anywhere I go - too risky). The sheets were white and clean. The pillows (5 of them) were downy soft and fluffy! I did not find the room to be too small. The hall did smell of smoke... but I didn't spend much time there and it did not effect the room.
