I am very antismoke and if the roomed smelled it would have been a BIG problem. It did not. Breakfast was included each morning (until 11am on weekends and 9:30 during the week). Cups, plates, bowls, and utensils were disposable. I would recommend bringing your coffee cup or glass from the room (near the ice bucket) down to breakfast to cut down on waste. Items: Cereal, yogurt, bagels, croissants, muffins, english muffins, danishes, instant hot chocolate/oatmeal, waffle maker, hard boiled eggs, cranberry/apple/orange juices, milk, apples and bananas. Carl the doorman was the go-to man for directions. Checkin and out was easy. They even held our bags so we didn't have to check in early and pay a fee. Equipped us with a map and recommended a few nearby sites and we were free to start our trip without lugging our bags with us. Location was great -- literally just around the corner from the CTA. Gino's East and Portillo's Hotdogs are within a short walk. The Mag mile is also very close and easily accessible by walking. Oh and complimentary internet access. I recommend it and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: momof2boys52
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Beautiful, huge, clean suite with fabulous view of city and water. Friendly staff. Great location at beginning of Magnificent Mile. Paid $169 per night which is a good value for what we got. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “More Info Ahead Of Time Would Have Been Nice”
Reviews.Author: Deluxe2k
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask how to get from the adjacent parking garage to the front door. There's no wifi, but there is hard-wired internet access. I couldn't get it to work, though. That may have been my issue, but wifi would be nice, to be sure. The hotel didn't charge my credit card until two days after departure and left the hold on the card until I called them about it three days after departure. The breakfast area is somewhat cramped and the choices are limited. Food quality was fair, but acceptable. Better food quality and larger selection for the rate charged would have been appreciated. Overall a decent enough experience. I'm on the fence as to whether or not I would return or recommend the property. I will admit to being partial to boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: KrAshton
Reviews.Content: Husband & I traveled to Chicago with another couple for a quick get-a-way. I found the Comfort Inn & Suites Downtown on lastminutetravel.com for $100/night. We couldn't have been happier with this hotel. We lived in Chicago for a few years, 10 years ago, so we know how important public transportation is in town. We were just steps from the red line and the 22 and 36 buses, as well as a 24 hour Jewel/Osco. We were there for 3 nights, ate and drank all over town & didn't step foot in a single taxi. We each spend $12 on a 3 day CTA pass. The hotel was super clean and very quite. It's true there are few rooms with views as it is sandwiched between two larger buildings. Personally, we don't go to chicago for the view. Staff was very friendly, lobby was clean and safe and coffee available 24 hours. We requested feather pillows and 5 were waiting for us upon our arrival. Yes, the rooms are small but provided everything we required. We hit up Chicago every summer and I look forward to staying at the Comfort Inn & Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “"Motel 6" in the city!”
Reviews.Author: PikePlaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: Mark be down as someone who was less than impressed with this positively-reviewed Comfort Inn. It is a semi-renovated hotel in the North Bridge area of Chicago. It's best quality is location - very close to the Magnificent Mile, and within walking distance of all the best sites in Chicago. But the downside.... Except for the handful of rooms facing the street, the rooms are like COFFINS. The hotel is sandwiched between two other buildings, and so most of the rooms face onto a lightwell. No matter what floor you're on, you feel buried. The room was totally no frills, in the same way that Motel 6 rooms are no frills. The room was clean, in the same way that Motel 6 rooms are (usually) clean. The in-room safe? It didn't work. Overall, less than impressed. If you're visiting Chicago, do yourself a favor and find a hotel that is situated on a corner of a block, so that you can get a room with windows and light and a view. I recommend the Comfort Inn only for the goth set.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: karigraf8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently while visiting friends. I was pleasantly surprised by the front desk person who checked us in promptly and was very courteous. She also had helpful tips on where to shop and dine without spending a fortune, while experiencing places that were less "touristy." Our room was clean and air conditioned when we arrived and the room was larger than we expected. Overall, our stay here was a great value, and would recommend this hotel for anyone who is staying in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad Customer Service...”
Reviews.Author: mmdhar
Reviews.Content: Front desk people are not friendly at all... as if they are trained to hate the customers. I found hair in my breakfast everyday... They have a fitness center...but, I wouldn't call it fitness center... They have atreadmill.. That's all...

Reviews.Title: “a gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: paulvAustralia
Reviews.Content: we selected this hotel from the internet,and it turned out to be fantastic,we had just spend the last two days on amtrak,travelling from utah.The location was great,fine restaurants and shops nearby and the city centre was just a couple of blocks,easily done by walking.The continental breakfast is free and you are spoiled with the choices available.The staff were tops they helped us and were always pleasant.The best thing of all was the cost,even though we booked over the internet,the rate was somewhat cheaper,but never the less,we would stay at this place again,whenever we come back this way.WE used this hotel as the yardstick to compare others on our adventure,sadly not many came close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, excellent service and unexpensive!!!”
Reviews.Author: PauBCN
Reviews.Content: During my last visit I spent 5 days in this hotel. My room was simple and perhaps small, but it was more than I needed after walking Michigan and State Streets up and dawn all day long! The bathroom was very clean and it had everything a 4-5 star hotel would offer. My room was close to the ice machine and was a little noise when someone used it. Free Breakfast and Internet service were included in the price and I really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: langericious
Reviews.Content: despite previous reviews about small rooms we found ours to be more than adequate 1501 on the top floor spotless to a t fine continental breakfast just 1 block off the magnificent mile easy walking distance from all the attractions for irish travellers fine food and drink at the kerryman bar just turn left outside the hotel and walk up to the rainforest cafe then turn right 2 blocks and there it is .the most spectacular scene is from the signature lounge in the john hancock building after dark u pay a few extra dollars on the drinks but the view is priceless and its higher than the observatory without an entrance fee and for the shopping macys and filenes basement down on state street are more comprehensive than those at the watertower end of the magnificent mile many great things to see and do in this lovely city has everything ny has only cleaner and quieter

Reviews.Title: “Spent a month here”
Reviews.Author: skurny
Reviews.Content: I actually was a long-term guest of this hotel because of a large project at work. I enjoyed the stay for the most part...the staff was friendly and helpful but my big issue is the rooms. I've stayed here on four or five seperate occasions and I've had one decent room. Some of the rooms are tiny! And by tiny I mean 10 feet by 15 feet max. I usually get put on the upper floors (15-17) and I'm not sure if that makes a difference or not but there's hardly room to move around. If you were only staying one night and were a solo traveler, it'd probably be fine. However, I'm usually there for at least three or four days straight. It's is a quiet hotel, which downtown is nice. However, if you open the window, you're immediately reminded that you're in downtown Chicago. That doesn't really bother me (I lived in New York for five years, Chicago for two) but keep in mind there is a fire station a few blocks away...and they're busy. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel but not for a long-term stay. Parking is $25 per night, which is pretty standard downtown, but beware.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent group sales & services”
Reviews.Author: JAC-EGYPT
Reviews.Content: Our group of 20 PAX were accommodated at the Comfort Inn Hotel in Chicago for a week. First of all, the group sales manager Marc Condie was extremely helpful and effective in getting quotation and finalizing the reservation. He proposed upgrade of 4 normal rooms to 4 suits. When the group has arrived to the property, they were settled very fast and efficient. Our stay was great. We would be happy to deal with this Hotel as a corporate client in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast and fab location”
Reviews.Author: vikkismile
Reviews.Content: I booked through lastminutetravel.com and this hotel came up as a 'secret location' option (where you're hotel isn't revealed until you are sent booking confirmation). The hotel was in a fantastic location, just around the corner from the subway and there is parking available right next to the hotel ($25 per night). The breakfast offered a lot of choice and in a buffet style whereby I could eat as much as I wanted to fill me up for a whole day exploring the city. The door staff are extremely friendly and helpful in answering questions about the city. I stayed two nights and towels and beds were made each morning after breakfast. The hotel rooms have internet available at no extra cost and although they are quite small there is a lot of storage space and an iron and ironing board in the room. I stayed on the 11th floor and had no problem with city noise and I couldn't hear noise from other rooms. I had a very pleasant stay and would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place? Good Value? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: localguy101
Reviews.Content: I found the place to be a good choice. It is a great location - near the fancy shopping and transit and buses. The hotel is clean and I found the staff to be friendly. If you are coming to Chicago to see Chicago this is a great place to stay. Take the money you save and enjoy it on a nice meal or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: facilit8or
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days visiting Chicago on a side trip to a business meeting in another state. As I was traveling solo, I was interested in finding safe, well located accommodation within walking distance of the city highlights. Though the room was small (which I expected) it was well laid out with everything that I needed - including a desk, free internet access (cable), a well appointed bathroom, comfortable bed and adjustable heating. The hotel has no restaurant but is close to a supermarket and restaurants. A casual breakfast buffet is included in the rate and all day coffee and tea are available from the same mezzanine area. The staff were friendly throughout my visit and very helpful on my day of departure - arranging for a cab to arrive at exactly the time I needed it. The only suggestion I would make is that the inclusion of a small fridge would have enhanced an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pwrof3
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel, I wasn't expecting too much. I figured I'd have to take the subway everywhere to get around town. When I arrived, my expecttions were blown out of the water. This hotel has a supermarket on one corner, the Weber Grill Restaurant on another, ESPN Zone on the next block, Pizzeria Uno on the other corner, a movie theater one block away, and the Rainforest Cafe and Rock n Roll McDonald's one block away. There is also a Subway across the street for a quick bite to eat. Magnificent Mile is about 5 minutes down the street, Navy Pier took me about 25 minutes to walk. The Red LIne Subway that takes you straight down to the Loop is less than a block away. The location is amazing! The Hotel Staff were all very friendly. When my cab pulled up, the bell staff were immediately picking up my suitcase and putting it in the lobby. The front desk staff were very friendly and informative. They even went online to print my boarding pass on the day of my flight! The front desk staff even held my suitcase all day long after I had checked out, with no hassle. The maid staff cleaned the room very well every day. The room itself was very small, but expected for a 1920's hotel. The room, overall, was very modern and everything was very clean and functional. The view from the window was nothing but a brick wall, which was kind of lame, but not a trip killer. As such, the sunlight never came in to the room, so I always had to have a desk light on. This is a great hotel for the location, price, and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Glitteranddust
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located-you can basically walk to the Magnificent mile in 2 minutes. It is also surrounded by great bars and trendy restaurants. The room is half the size of a regular hotel room but I think that was the right size for Chicago downtown and the price. The hotel needs some maintenance, especially the elevator (was kind of dirty look). I was fairly disappointed with the service-I called at 11 am in advance asking them whether I could have a 2 hour late check out (meaning check out at 2 pm paying 20 USD extra) and they said yes. But then every 15 minutes there was some maid coming or a call reminding me that I should check out. In addition, after I finally could not take it and decided to check out at 1 pm and asked whether I could check my bags, they said yes and then asked me to wait and I waited for 10 minutes. I decided to give up and the receptionist saw me leave and turned her eyes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jpintransit
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying in this hotel. The location could not be beat. Just about everything was walking distance with plenty of restaurants and shopping along the way. Each corner I turned, I saw something else to do or see. I was only there 3 days but it felt like I got good use of my time because of where the hotel was located. However, if you are traveling to Chicago for a little R&R, this hotel may not be for you. It is located on a busy street and you defintely hear the sounds of the city, not to mention your neighbors. Also, the room is a bit small so a traveling couple or family may feel a little cramped and I did hear someone complain about a lack of cell phone service in their room. But if the room is just for sleeping, showering, and changing, then it is perfect. Oh and the continental breakfast was decent, you could even make your own waffles. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when I go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “You can access to many shopping pionts by walk.”
Reviews.Author: Ken_Boon_Yam
Reviews.Content: My room charge was US$230 before tax per night. This is my record of the most expensive night in Comfort group ever stayed ($_$)... As somebody mentinoed below, the room is small, but you may find bigger room with just additional small expense. I feel this point when checking floor plan , not confirmed yet. Even it is small room, it is still better than tourists hotel in Hong Kong. I drove to Chicago , and it is very convenient of car park key which hotel provided me with US$25/night. Michigan avenue is famouse shopping , business street as you know. We can walk and enjoy this street. You may not need car while you're around city center for your visiting. Fleming's steak house is just second next buidling from this hotel. We took dinner here to celebrate our marriage day with good cooking beef and good taste of wine. Ah, Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cas0325
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a typical downtown Chicago experience for $188 a night but what I got was so much more. The hotel is ideally located near all the theater, shopping and restaurants Chicago has to offer. The staff is helpful, the complimentary breakfast is more than adequate including make-your-own waffles and the sheets, pillows and towels and all high quality and comfy. Ask for room 1209 if you want tons of room and complete silence and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelpro74
Reviews.Content: I advise buyer beware when considering this hotel. The rooms are very small, poorly furnished, and without adequate lighting. Most rooms have no natural light. Security is not adequate and do not meet minimal standards. I love Chicago, and have stayed at much nicer 3 star hotels for the same price. Chatting with others in the elevator only confirmed this is a general impression. I spent very little time in the hotel, and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: StokePotter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a week in Chicago at the end of April. We stayed at the Comfort Inn. From the very start, the service we received from all the staff was very good. The reception staff were very helpful and professional. About half an hour after we got to the room, reception rang to check everything was OK (which it was). We had requested a quiet room and this was sorted out for us. It had a dual aspect (although there was only a car park and the inner part of the hotel to look at), so this meant it was quite dark. However, the room was very large and comfortable. The breakfast was of a good standard. However, within the breakfast room, there really needed to be more tables and chairs, rather than sofas. There is a conference room next to the breakfast room, which you can use if there isn't a conference taking place. When we used the conference room, we got to talk to other guests. Chicago is a lovely town - very walkable. The Chicagoans were very friendly. I can recommend a baseball game at either the White Sox or the Cubs. The weather was quite variable - one day it was 80Â°F/26Â°C, the next 55Â°F/12Â°C. I can also recommend the Historic Skyscraper Architectural Walking Tour and dinner on the 96th floor of the John Hancock Centre. I will definitely return to Chicago and will stay at the Comfort Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: boomer07
Reviews.Content: Very clean. The hotel staff was excellent. Excellent cont. breakfast. Location is perfect. Bus and subway stops at the corner. Great for walking to many locations. Several restaraunts very, very close. Michigan Ave, only 2 or 3 blocks. The only problem with this hotel, if you don't get a suite, the rooms are TINY. But they are the cleanest rooms this side of Las Vegas. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in Big City”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights this past weekend. It is really a nice hotel - some old world charm (building is from the 1920's), but recently refurbished. Doesn't feel like a chain at all. Decor and fixtures are all modern and in excellent condition. We had a suite (my sister, 14 year old nephew and myself), and it came with microwave, refrigerator, sink in the living room. Bathroom, shower, beds - all great. Front desk personnel couldn't be nicer and more helpful - they really seemed to take pride in their customer service. They helped with bus routes, restaurants, etc. Continental breakfast very nice - hard boiled eggs, waffles, yogurt, juice, bakery. My only complaint (and this is getting picky) is that there wasn't enough seating in the breakfast area - too many sofas and coffee tables that should be replaced with tables. Last but not least - excellent location. Walking distance either way up Michigan Ave to Water Tower, John Hancock or other direction to Millenium Park and Art Museum. Convenient to buses on both State Street or Michigan Ave. Next door to ESPN Zone (great for kids). Chicago Tip: Get a visitor bus pass. They have them in train station and I believe John Hancock center too. $5 for one day, $9 for 2. Chicago buses are very convenient and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MidMissouriTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a vacation in Chicago, mostly to shop and eat on the Magnificent Mile. It was great; and it was only two blocks from Magnificent Mile. Somehow we ended up with a suite without asking for it or paying anything extra (probably because we got in so late). Parking was cheap ($25 compared to $46 at other hotels on the Mile), maybe because there was no direct parking garage access to the hotel and you had to walk out of the garage to get to the hotel. The breakfast was great and had everything you could think of. The rooms were very clean and mostly everything looked newish. The only reason I didn't give this place a five was that the comforters have not been updated to the duvet style like most other hotels. Also, because I was a Choice Privileges member (maybe Gold) I got check-out extended until 2:00.

Reviews.Title: “Suite LIfe”
Reviews.Author: Doobies25
Reviews.Content: I must say I was very impressed with the decor and the rooms. Definately not your normal comfort Inn & Suites that you see off to the road on the interstate. The bathrooms are very clean and has an elegant feeling to the design. The view of the North End of the chicago skyline is wonderful and everything is in walking distance as far as resturants and bars. I definately loved the bed that had 8 pillows that were not too hard or too soft. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristirailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in a suite. The room was very clean and well decorated. The hotel's location is an easy walking distance to ALL of the shops on Michigan Avenue. The hotel staff was helpful, however we didn't really need them too much. Go got a great rate through CRShotels.com. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MathiasStockholm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel on our last days of our honeymoon in september 2007. Check in went smoothly. We had a nice standard room with a large bathroom. We paid 189 USD/night , which I thought was a great deal for this hotel. A complimentary breakfast buffet is served every morning. We loved it! When you stay here you will be in a fantastic location in downtown Chicago North side. Close to michgan ave and really close to clark street were a lot of nice blues clubs are situated. Right across from our hotel at State street you will find a place called Pops For Champagne. It was a really nice cozy place with Champagne bar and live jazz. Do check it out!! We love Chicago and will return again and again.. We will choose this hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelingwithTandM
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, comfortable. Great staff. Only hotel I have booked on line that responded personally to my request for quiet room. Could not be happier with location. Walking distance to everything north of the river, and just 1 1/2 blocks from Red Line. Recommend to anyone who wants to stay near the Miracle Mile, loves pizza, and is looking for a "personal' sized hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location; Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Muppetbaby
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and chose this hotel primarily because of easy access to the metro. It did not disappoint me at all and I am very pleased that my experience with the hotel is in line with all the good stuff I read about it from the web. First, the breakfast offered had a reasonable variety of breads, cereals and juices. LIke other reviewers, I too was bowled over by the hot waffles. The fact that all this was free really wowed me. Second, the hotel staff was SO helpful and polite when giving directions and assisting with requests. The metro was just 1.5 blocks away but I was hopeless with directions and one of the staff was kind enough to walk me there himself. In addition, they put me in a smoking floor the first night and I asked for a change of rooms. They gave me one the next day and helped me to move everything over. Later, I realized that I left my travel adaptor in the first room and they helped me to bring it back. I give a thumbs up to the service level in this hotel. Third, the location was just fantastic. I could get to everywhere very quickly either by metro or on foot. There was food nearby and a supermarket to meet my grocery needs. Finally, the condition of the rooms was good, everything was clean and the air smelt ok. All in all, I would definitely stay here again when I come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: meadkelly
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, complimentary tea and coffee is served 24hours a day in a really trendy lounge. Very clean, lovely beds, plenty of room. The bubble bath and sauna are great after a day of shopping. Staff were very helpful. Not much of a view from the bedroom, but we didnt care about that.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Bimbohead
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the 2007 Chicago Marathon and stayed at the Comfort Inn in Downtown Chicago. The hotel is really well situated for Michigan Ave, where all the "nice" shops are and (crucially) if you are coming from O'Hare airport, as we were, it has a train station situated right around the corner. For $2 you can travel 18 miles into the city centre! What more do you want? Even more satisfying is the fact that the track runs parallel for a good few miles with the Kennedy Expressway, which seems almost permanently gridlocked, so you can congratulate yourself on saving time AND money getting the train! We found the hotel more than met our needs and expectations. I simply cannot understand why people are griping about it. Our room number was 1204 and I will admit it was a little dark, as it faced an inner courtyard with little natural light, but being on the 12th floor and not facing the main street has distinct advantages when it comes to blocking out traffic noise, so we were more than happy. We had a very comfy bed, with loads of pillows, great air-conditioning and a really cool bathroom, with a heated light on a timer. The shower worked really well, we had complimentary newspapers and the coffee making facilities were easy to use (although biscuits might have been nice)! The biggest benefit to us as a couple was free wi-fi, which enabled us to hold video conversations with our kids in England over the webcam. Saved a fortune in mobile phone charges! Breakfast was great. Lots of choice and plenty of it. The only downside for me was that the breakfast area was extremely small and you struggled to get a table, as the hotel was full of marathon runners all wanting to eat at the same time! The staff had no problem with you removing food to your room if you chose to do so. They even arranged for the hours to be altered on marathon day to cater for those who had to eat by 6am. I hope the staff got a bonus for being up so early! The staff were friendly and professional. No complaints whatsoever about them. I do wonder if people choosing this hotel and rating it unfavourably are expecting the Cannes Carlton. This is not a particularly "high end" hotel, but it is worth the money and does exactly what it says it will. You will have a comfortable night in the Comfort Inn! Whilst the Chicago Hilton might be grander (and it was, because we attended a party there) the food was cold, poor value for money and the staff much less friendly. Give me the Comfort Inn anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: BraddyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situted for downtown Chicago, but is really very basic, and not what I expected. The rooms (allocated to me and my group) were very small, dark, with little daylight, backing on to a multistory car park. There were no hotel facilities at all! Only vending machines. No bar, cafeteria, restaurante, business center, nothing. A disappointing continential breakfast was served on the first floor in a small area with only 7 or 8 tables, and a funny kind of sofa arrangement. There was not enough space for all the guests wanting to take breakfast to sit down, and many had to stand up. The plates, glasses and cutlery were all plastic.The second day we all went out for breakfast. I guess this place would be okay for low budget travellers with low expectations, but it is by no means a mid-class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Mid-MN-Tourist
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed at the comfort Inn and Suites over Laor Day Weekend and thought it was a great location, continental breakfast was good. The hotel is clean and everyone is very polite. Thanks to trip advisor forums for the comments, it helped in our decision. We would stay here again the next time we are in Chicago. Lots of bar's. dining and attractions within walking distance of hotel. Thanks Chicago fro a great weekend !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dancetraveller
Reviews.Content: A step above other outposts of this extensive chain, the Comfort Inn Downtown boasts an excellent location just minutes from the Magnificent Mile and 20 minutes by foot from Millenium Park. It is modest, but the rooms are surprisingly comfortable, a step above your average strip mall Comfort Inn. There's marble in the bathrooms, and some rooms are set up like a suite. Ours, 1202, was divided into a living area, with mini-fridge, microwave, kitchen sink, large desk and television, and a sleeping area, with its own TV and AC unit. We loved this set up, and it added a level of luxury we weren't expecting. But be forewarned: if you're not in a suite, the rooms can be quite small--still with some premium fixings--but small, and many of the rooms face an inner courtyard with only a large shaft of light. Considering the noise of the city, this might be an advantage. And given all there is to do in Chicago, you might not need a lot of space. But to guarantee the space you need, look into the possibility of a suite. Service was accommodating and polite; housekeeping was wonderfully quiet and respectful. There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel (Japanese place next door is good), so there's no scene. There's a Whole Foods Market on Huron, three blocks away, which is great for stocking that mini-fridge with healthy snacks. A solid, comfortable establishment in the midst of a classy urban environment.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Comfort Inn & Suites on E. Ohio in Chicago, IL”
Reviews.Author: sfowler
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites in the North River Chicago area on E. Ohio. The room was very clean, great towels and bedding and location was close enough to attractions (Navy Pier)) and transportation systems. Self-parking was available with in/out priviledges (which is a premium in downtown Chicago) and not too steep, and the in-house continental breakfast was good. Would definitely stay there again as it was very reasonable and suited our needs -- just don't bring a car if you can help it. Very easy to get around and save parking fees and aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SonomaCo_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Comfort Inn and Suites in downtown Chicago and were very pleased with the experience. I booked it thru the website of the airline I used and got a great deal. Our room was on the 7th floor and faced the street, but was very quiet. We had a nice view of the city. The room was a little small, but very clean and the bathroom was especially nice. For a lower cost hotel, I thought the free breakfast buffet was wonderful - so much to choose from including hot waffles! We parked in the lot adjacent to the hotel ($25.00/night) but never needed to take the car out - we were convenient to everything. Navy Pier was an easy walk. Two years ago, we stayed at the Best Western River North, Chicago, and had planned to stay there again. Their prices had gone up, so I decided to try something else and I am glad I did. River North was fine and had free parking, but overall, I like the Comfort Inn better. The lobby was much nicer and they had someone there to help us book a city tour. If you prefer to spend more of your money on restaurants and attractions, but still want a comfortable night's sleep, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sarah9540
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 5 day 4 night trip to Chicago and if we come back to the city, we'll definitely stay here again. This hotel is within walking distance to many main attractions---the magnificent mile, Navy Pier, many very good restaurants (Pizzeria Uno is basically next door), etc. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was small, as described in other reviews, however we used it just to sleep and shower so it was perfect for us. If you want a place with a balcony and lots of sitting area, this is not the hotel for you. The beds were not bad----nothing exceptional like pillow tops or anything, but were good enough for a restful nights sleep. I was particularly happy about the hot water for the shower---plenty of it and definitely hot. They offer a continental breakfast which was more than adequate----especially if you plan on eating all the other foods Chicago has to offer throughout the day. There are bagels, cereal, fruit (a little lacking there), Belgian waffles, pastries and hard boiled eggs. Only downfall is breakfast is over at 9am during the week. Weekends is at 11am. Check in was at 3pm and very easy. Check out is at noon, but for $5 we could stay til 2pm. Our only complaint overall was the Internet service. There was supposed to be service in our room, however there wasn't. I'm assuming it was just a freak thing----just bad timing for us that the rooms were unable to get access. Service was available if you took your laptop to the 2nd floor (lounge area) or 1st floor (lobby). It was a slight inconvenience for us---however we were only using the Internet to search for a few local things and our email. We weren't here on business so it wasn't imperative for us to have access. If you definitely need service in your room for work or whatever, you may want to confirm there really is access always and make sure the outage wasn't just during the days we were here. On a side note, good places to eat: Giordanos for deep dish pizza, Pizano's (Italian---portions are huge--alfredo really good), Quartinos, Jakes (bar nearby---good bar food), Ditka's restaurant next to the Tremont Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: busyinWilmington
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, walked all over Chicago from our hotel. Very close to "el", restaurants and Michigan Ave. Walking distance to downtown business area and Navy Pier. Very clean. Room was a little small but more than adequate for a couple (you don't go to Chicago to stay in the room). Breakfast was adequate. We had a good view (Rm 801) but could see how the other side of hotel might not have such a great view (lots of buildings in way). Would stay again--got a good price for Chicago. Tip: Eat on the 96th floor of the Handcock Bldg.--make reservations for dinner or lunch (if you want a seat by window). Great view, relaxing, don't have to pay to go up to the observatory and can spend as much time as you want enjoying view and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sherikjrj
Reviews.Content: Great location with easy access to all downtown attractions. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Have stayed here several times and never disappointed. Staff always wonderful and willing to answer quesitons on how to get around town and where various attractions are located. Breakfast is always well stocked and delicious with a staff member on hand to keep things in order. This hotel is a MUST STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. A Little Expensive. Otherwise Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: pixfield
Reviews.Content: Good Points: Great location near Red Line metro stop Very courteous staff Close by to Michigan Avenue shopping Close to many good eating spots For those of you who like Pizzeria Uno, it is just steps away Clean, comfortable and quiet Not So Good Points: Price-at $270 per night for a suite I did not get a good value. Breakfast-pedestrian selection of sweet rolls, tarts, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: francocaro
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites for two nights on June 29 - 30, 2007. The location of this hotel is excellent and we were thrilled to be able to walk everywhere over the weekend. If you are going to be there within the next 8 days (week of July 4, 2007), be sure to check out the Taste of Chicago! (www.tasteofchicago.us) It was great fun! The lake and Michigan Avenue are only a few blocks to the right when you exit the hotel. The hotel itself is very nice. Our room was very small, but we didn't mind since we didn't spend a lot of time in it. The bathroom was very clean, as was the entire room. We had only one small window, which looked onto a nearby wall, but again, we just wanted a place to sleep. The breakfast buffet was fantastic for me because there was a waffle maker! My boyfriend was a little disappointed. They offered coffee, juices, several cereals, hard-boiled eggs, pastries, and bagels. And the waffle maker of course, yum! The eating area is a little awkward since it was pretty busy both mornings and set up like a living room with a few tables nearby, but overall not bad. Just a tip, there are only two small elevators and they're pretty slow. If you are checking out near checkout time, are on a lower floor, and have lots of luggage, it might take a while to get an elevator that can fit you in. I saw several people waiting and not able to get in because of this. We flew into O'Hare (on the top 5 list of worst airports nationwide - lots of delays) and took the train/blue line to the Clark stop. It's very easy and only costs $2 per person. If you don't want to walk to the hotel from there, the cab ride is only about $5-10. I hope that helps! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel seemed to go out of their way to be courteous and helpful. The location is excellent, and our room was large, clean, and comfortable. We were really impressed and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richbutnot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights with Choice Privilege Points which saved us close to $1100. The location is great, just a short walk to the bus stop on Michigan Avenue or the train on State Street. The folks at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was slightly above average. Hot Tub came in handy after walking museums all day. Room was very quiet with a fridge and microwave. Others have said the rooms are small, but ours was quite large. Plenty of room for two parents, two teenagers and an air mattress for one of the kids to sleep on. The only thing we didn't like was the double beds, but we couldn't find a hotel in the city with queen beds anyway. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: emalemaloo
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a "family" trip, but all adults. Myself (34) and my parents (66 and 67). We had never done Chicago before, so we just picked a random hotel with a good reputation and went with it! What a lucky random pick! The hotel is about 2 blocks from all the magnificent shopping on the Magnificent Mile, has a ton of restaurants within walking distance, and has the nicest staff I've ever had the fortune to meet! We arrived at O'Hare and took a cab to the property, which ran about $42. They offer shuttle service through continental, but it was only going to save us about $6, so we just did the cab thing. When we arrived I was very ill (motion sickness from a cab ride, a total first for me), and as soon as my dad mentioned it, the bellman actually offered to run to the pharmacy for me if I needed it, and the front desk clerk offered to get me a Sprite from the machine downstairs! All the staff were like that, super friendly and willing to go to any lengths to keep you happy! The rooms are sort of suites. They have a single bathroom in the middle, and to the left is the bedroom (2 double beds, a dresser and a TV) and to the right is a small sitting area with a wet bar, closet, TV, desk and sleeper sofa. My parents took the beds, and I slept on the sleeper sofa. Quite comfy, surprisingly! I closed the bed up every morning, and when I came back at night, the maid had pulled the bed out, changed and remade the bed. That takes some dedication! The room was always spotless when we returned. The continental breakfast is offered daily 'til 10 thru the week and 'til 11 on weekends. Had your standard pastries, muffins, fruit, yogurt, etc. Also had a "make your own" belgian waffle station and a chaffing dish full of boiled eggs. Several kinds of fruit juice, milk, water, hot tea, coffee. Small sitting area, but we were always able to have a table. Within walking distance are: Big Bowl (Thai, great homemade ginger ale), California Kitchens Pizza, Weber Grill restaurant, PF Chang. There is a grocery store just around the corner (Jewel Osco), Bloomingdales Home and Design within Reach are across the street. The Grand Train Station is just behind the hotel. The #65 bus comes to that station as well. The hotel is a restored 1920's building and the lobby and mezzanine are beautiful. All in all, the PERFECT place to stay in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: mrbula
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Comfort Inn for a few days in April 2007 and were very impressed with it. While it can't be understated how small our room was--I'd estimate it came in under 250 square feet--it was well appointed, comfortable and very clean. The staff was friendly, and the continental breakfast was excellent. The location was what really made the deal for us. The Comfort Inn is only a couple of blocks from the Mile, and the nearest Red Line stop is just around the corner. The price was very good as well: Our two-night weekend stay came in under $300, including parking. A tip about requesting rooms: There are only four street-facing rooms on each floor, so if you want any kind of a view, you may want to ask ahead. Two of those street-facing rooms (including the one we stayed in) are incredibly tiny. If you want space, you may have to sacrifice your view. (See the floor map photo I uploaded to get an idea as to the different room sizes.) We'd recommend the Comfort Inn, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: brickbark
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you decide you want a good location within walking distance to the magnificent mile and VERY close to the red line subway. The rooms are tiny...I mean REALLY tiny. Everything was very clean, though, and the staff was EXCELLENT, very friendly and concerned with making it a great stay. Appears to be recently renovated. Good workout facilities and large whirlpool in the basement. The free breakfast was a nice added touch too. Parking is somewhat of a pain (no valet and you have to walk around the block each time you want to enter the hotel), but you get unlimited in/out privelages. Overall I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: bear628
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites. I was only there one night, but the front desk was SO friendly and helpful. They quickly checked me in and answered any questions I had. The room was very clean, though it was a little small. I was placed in a handicap accessible room so I was surprised there wasn't more room around the sides of the bed. The bathroom was very spacious, my only complaint was there was no medicine cabinet or place to put my toiletries. The sink had a big soap dish on one side of the faucet so very little room for even my toothpaste, let alone my other stuff on the other side. The room was extremely quiet and dark at night. The window didn't have a view (just 3 other walls of what appeared to be the rest of the building). The A/C unit was a little loud when it kicked on in the middle of the night. It woke me up scared half to death when it sounded like a jet taking off in my room. I got used to it, but it wasn't the best. I had trouble connecting to the internet (I got the required CAT-5 cable from the front desk) but I don't know if it was because I was using a Mac or what. I didn't feel like dealing with it because it was late and I was checking out in the morning, but I'm sure if I called the front desk, they would have helped me out. The continental breakfast in the morning was fantastic. Lots of options to choose from, cereal, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt my personal favorite, belgian waffles, and more. Perfect way to start the morning. I wish I could have stayed longer to get more of my stay but I was only in town one day for business. The location of this hotel was really ideal. They are right next door to several great restaurants including Pizzeria Uno (the original, I think) and Pizzeria Due (the second one) as well as Weber Grill and ESPN Zone. It was really easy to get to from the airport in a cab (about $34, before tip, with no traffic). All in all, I thought it was a great hotel for a great price right in downtown Chicago. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “staff were not helpful!”
Reviews.Author: hollabrolics
Reviews.Content: we stayed that this hotel for one night, it's clean and updated. but the staff did did not help us, when we got a smoking room. we had asked for a non-smoking room. all other rooms were taken. oh, and the parking is $25 a day that suck! it's in the heart of the city which is a plus! warning you now, the rooms are 10 by 14. small as all hell.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early March 2007. The location is fantastic, 2 blocks from Michigan Ave. The hotel is clean and quiet. Not the most spacios, but not the tightest either. No moldy shower, no warn out carpet, clean breakfast area. Parking is convenient in the garage directly behind hotel and It's $25 which isn't too bad by Chicago standards. The breakfast bar is decent - standard continental with a waffle maker, cereal, breads, rolls, etc... The view from our room was terrible - looking into a small, closed in courtyard of nastyness. If you need a view, request a room looking outside! The only other complain I had was the coffe at the brekfast area. It was literally undrinkable swill. Really, really bad. But hey, if that's the biggest complaint then it's not too bad! Plus there's a starbuck's right across the street, and a million more around Chicago. We'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish....very nice!”
Reviews.Author: kjsdunn
Reviews.Content: Good value for the location! Front desk and staff are very friendly. Everything was scrupulously clean, and appears to have been recently remodeled. Our first room was extremely small, but they moved us to a larger room when asked. The breakfast area and selection was also very nice and scrupulously clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: V.T.45
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT hotel! We have stayed here once a month since Sept. 2006 for family business a total of five times. The staff is helpful and friendly.The parking garage located next to the hotel is very convienent ,with in and out privleges.Tons of restaurants and shopping all within walking distance.Very clean rooms a bit small but fine for the amount of time we are in the room.Plan on eating breakfast,they have a nice selection of quick foods(bagels, cereal ,fresh fruit etc). Good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robber-MI
Reviews.Content: Did a last minute trip to Chicago before Christmas and stayed at the Choice Inn Downtown on Ohio St. This hotel exceeded my expectations. We had a 2 dbl bed suite.. very large, with the LR part separate from the beds. Nice view looking out on Ohio St. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast had normal items, and everything was fresh. Check in was quick and efficient. I think of Choice Inn as a mid-level hotel.. In general it seemed like we were staying at a much nicer hotel. I was very pleased with my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: muffin98
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel in great location; with a wonderful breakfast. Thanks to Tim and staff for a wonderful stay; they were great! We would definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: eak99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a great location - close to El stop on red line, numerous restaurants within a block or two, major shopping nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful, room was clean and quiet - there was no view, but when we wanted to see Chicago, we just went outside and walked around. We had a room with 2 beds, which was very spacious, and the small fridge and microwave came in handy. Oh yeah, the breakfast buffet was a nice surprise too, didn't know they had that, so we saved even more by being able to have fruit/juice, coffee, toasted bagels, etc. rather than going out for breakfast, then we had a nice lunch later at one of the area restaurants. I have stayed at several other hotels in Chicago, and this is hands-down the best in terms of location and amenities for the price. Speaking of price, I checked all the hotel booking sites and finally made my reservation through the Comfort Inns website and got their "internet rate" which was the lowest of all options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SSP
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an unbeatable location and reasonable prices. There were three of us in our room, and it was nice size. We had a microwave and small refrigerator. There was plenty of room to stow our clothing. The hotel is right of State Street and only two blocks from the Magnificent Mile. There are dozens of good restaurants close by, and the hotel has a very good complimentary breakfast including waffles, cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, etc. I'd definitely go there again on another trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NEOTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from 8/17 through 8/19/06. The location of this hotel is great. Very close to downtown shopping, Navy Pier, Millenium Park. Our room was super clean and I expected it to be small as most downtown Chicago hotel rooms tend to be. Our room didn't have a view, just of a nasty-looking alley and the building next door. We got a great rate of $129/night directly from the hotel's website (click on "internet specials" on the rate type). Also, continental breakfast was included which was a great savings considering the restaurant prices downtown. The hotel staff was very helpful and even printed our Southwest Airlines boarding passes free of charge (we've been charged $5.00 each for these in Las Vegas). It was overall an excellent value and an excellent room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, again!”
Reviews.Author: llint77
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this Comfort Inn. We were so impressed the first time we had to stay there again with our friend from Ireland. The location is perfect and the rooms are nice, clean, and the perfect size. We will definately stay there on our next trip to Chicago and our Irish friend is recommending it to his friends who will be visiting Chicago soon.

Reviews.Title: “"Un-Chainlike" Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OLindquist
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel - a great location with personality. I did not expect a Comfort Inn to be located so conveniently nor be as upscale is this one. It dispels any negative connotation of a "chain" -- rooms that felt anything but cookie-cutter, a wonderful continental breakfast, and very helpful staff. Sleeping rooms were very comfortable, surprisingly spacious and appointed with high-end finishes. Only negatives would views of the side and back walls of its neighbors and a small "street presence". I have stayed in other "value" hotels in Mangificent Mile and would never go back to the others, having stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: casualtraveler2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in downtown Chicago, a block away from the Grand Ave. redline stop and two blocks from Michigan Ave. The rooms aren't huge but comfortable with your own switch for the air conditioner/heater. The bed was extremely comfortable and the decor was nice and not the least bit run down. The bathroom was decent size with great water pressure. This is a well taken care of hotel. They serve a good complimentary continental breakfast each morning consisting of cold cereals, bagels/english muffins, and assortment of sweetrolls and muffins, criossants, fruits, hard boiled eggs, instant oatmeals, a variety of juices, and yogurt. It was served on the 2nd floor in a opened foyer area. During the work week, a USA Today paper was delivered to the room every morning. Choice Hotels offers a guaranteed lowest rate through their website or else they willl match, plus 10% off a lower priced website. I found the same $200 room for a $121 at Last Minute Travel,. I put in my claim, and got the room for $108 a night. The only glitch was that the hotel itself did not know it when I checked in but I had my paperwork with me, they accepted it and we spent a great 5 nights with them at half the cost. WARNING: If you find a lower rate, you have to compare it to their standard rates--you can't put in for any discounts, like AAA. I would definitely stay here again. We were there six days and couldn't have had a more centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gregbkc
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Chicago I normally stay at the Best Western Hawthorne Terrace in Lakeview. Since that wonderful hotel was sold out (no surprise) I decieded to try this hotel since I got a great rate considering there was a large convention in town that weekend. Cons - 1: The towels in my room were just plain horrible, comparing them to sandpaper would be an understatement. If I ever stay here again, I'll bring my own. 2: Can't think of anything else! Pros - 1: Location - Red Line only one block away and the hotel sits right in the midst of everything Chicago is all about. 2: The staff was very pleasant. Easy/Quick check in. 3: The room was fantastic. (room 1103). Not sure if I somehow got upgraded, but I was expecting a small room with a queen bed. Instead we got a two room suite (two beds in one room w/ TV and another sitting room with sofa, TV, microwave and mini fridge). Nice contemporary decor and very clean. I'd definately stay here again if i was looking for a room downtown and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “No probs at the Comf.Inn...give it a shot!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBuckeye
Reviews.Content: I feel obligated to ofer an opinion of the CI after reading about so many whining about such ridiculous things. If you want a large room, go to Las Vegas! Room was fine. Not super small. Had been remodeled, and the bath had been as well. I sen some even whine about the breakfast. You must be kidding. Most give you NOTHING. It was fine, with a good assortment of bagels, juices, etc etc. Yes it is a small area. So? We had NO view, unless you like a builing and alley. However the location is very convenient to THE mile, Hard Rock, ESPN, the Red line etc. We got a fairly decent rate (in comparison) on a site recommended to us, which was similar to price line. Bout $120 total I think. On a Sat. night too. I would recommend the place. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay With Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: mimifg
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves to be in the Top 20 for all hotels in Chicago. It is comfortable, with appropriate amenities (whirlpool, dry sauna, small workout room, free breakfast). I stay here about 5 times a year when visiting Chicago. The staff are helpful and friendly but not overly solicitious (which is good in my book), the hotel is nicely decorated in the deco style and the rooms are smallish but easy to maneuver around - bathrooms are perfectly adequate with stocked amenities. I have noticed more and more families are staying here, and the breakfast room is a freak show of children at certain hours of the morning with Cheerios and Bananas all over the place, but on the whole it is a pleasant stay and very nicely situated downtown. This used to be a nice hotel for business and European travelers, but word has gotten out, prices have gone up, and you see many more "t-shirt and white socks" tourists with small children. Be forewarned if you mean to check in at 3 pm as it is crawling with tourists needing lots of advice from staff about where to go, what to do, where is the bus, where is the Red Line El (hint: around the corner at State St. to your left past Weber Grill). But hey, its a Comfort Inn, so it is what it is. Still, a good place to stay. Rooms are quiet. Beds could have a better thread count for the sheets considering the price of the room (which are crawling higher even during the slow seasons). My only real complaint is that the front desk staff (during my stay at least) are clueless to their internet service. Above the 3rd floor, the hotel is not wireless, which I would HIGHLY recommend to this hotel. I plugged in my computer and know how to handle settings (disable wireless, use LAN connections, etc.) and the hotel staff kept telling me it was my computer when I knew the problem was their connection (or lack thereof). When I called tech support, they told me the hotel indeed needed to reset their internet server, which no one knew how to do at the hotel, so the "free internet" didn't count this last trip. I moved over to the Palmer House for another stay later that week and plugged right in (they are also not wireless and charge 9.95 per 24 hours) and was immediately on the net. But then that is comparing apples to oranges - the Palmer House has its own I.T. staff. So for what its worth, a good hotel which is changing over to a more touristy spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkee1
Reviews.Content: Went for a "girls' weekend"; 7 of us stayed at the Comfort Inn. We had 3 rooms with 2 double beds, and one room with 1 queen bed. It was WONDERFUL. Everything was new, clean, contemporary. Our room had a fridge, coffee maker, microwave, wet bar, safe, hairdryer, two phones, CD player, and plenty of fluffy towels. Beds were comfy. Climate control worked great, and shower spray was nice and strong. Staff was excellent! Great customer service from everyone we encountered. Excellent continental breakfast (expanded) and coffee and tea available 24 hours a day. PERFECT location. Some of the complaints I read on Tripadvisor about rooms being too small ... our rooms with 2 double beds were quite large. The room with 1 queen bed was certainly smaller ... but I think you get what you pay for. There was some noise because our room was close to a parking structure (car alarms, etc.), but you gotta expect that when you're staying in a big city. Bring your foam earplugs and you'll sleep comfy and cozy like a baby. I travel extensively and this was an above-average hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and noisy”
Reviews.Author: HotelfanNetherlands
Reviews.Content: First the pros: in the city center with many dinner options around (Rush str., Weber's Grill, Starbucks just around the corner), the breakfast buffet was monotonous but ok. Several breads, donuts, coffee, milk, juices but everything on plastic plates. Very clean. Cons: tiny! And I say that being European. The rooms in this hotel are little cages. Suffocating atmosphere reinforced by the view from our window (see pix). The room hardly fitted me and my suitcase. Noisy! Terribly! The door of our room did not close well-and I mean the door giving to the corridor so we had to wake up the entire night (every night!) from the voices of other people coming in their rooms. Very unpleasant. The Internet did NOT work and noone cared. Basically the front desk staff couldn't care less about the guests. Unfriendliness behaviour which shocked me given how wonderful Chicagoeans are. So if you travel for business, you'd better forget about this hotel or be prepared to have a not working Internet and noone willing to fix the problem. Not sure if I will stay there again unless I cant find anything more decent at a similar prce in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for the new year. Arrived on the 26.12.05 and stayed for 6 days. We booked a double room. We had 2 double beds, microwave, sink, tea and coffee making facilities in room which was great and a large bathroom. We made use of the in-room(payable)movies most nights. The hotel is in a good location - walking distance to all areas. We walked from the hotel to the aquarium but it is easier and quicker to take the metro. Walking took about 45 minutes but the metro took 15 mins. Metro is located just around the corner from this hotel. Breakfast is continental - bread, cereal, scones etc..but you can go down and grap what you want and bring it back to your room as the eating area is not very big - only about 5 table and chairs. There is a great food shop across the road, so you can pick up anything you need there, they have a great selection of sushi. On the other side of the road is the Red Lobester Restaurant and a great littel blues club - can't remember the name but it is tiny and they play good music. This hotel is by no means the fanciest hotel I have stayed in but it has everything you will need from a hotel and it is great value for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel. Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: traceyse
Reviews.Content: I booked our room at the comfort Inn directly through their website. It was my first time in Chicago, and we were looking forward to hitting the Thanksgiving sales. After a long and boring flight from the UK, we arrived at the hotel early. However the staff at the front desk managed to find us a room that was ready. We had a slight mix up at check in over the price of the room, but Tim managed to sort it out straight away. We booked a magifecent double, and compared to UK hotels it was huge. It was lovely and clean, warm and welcoming. We had a coffee maker and microwave, (which came in very handy, as we arrived on Thanksgiving and all the restuarants were closed. There is also tea and coffee available at no extra cost 24 hours a day from the breakfast area on the 2nd floor The hotel is the perfect base for entertainment and shopping. Starbucks one one corner, Bed bath and beyond and Jewel Osco on the opposite corner, Walgreens a couple of blocks away.Michigan ave and State street a few minutes walk. Just around the corner is the free Navy Pier trolley stop, and the CTA Red Line. I needed some bus and train information, because I had not taken my laptop I wasn't quite sure how to find the information I needed, the staff were more than happy to print me off some schedules from the PC'S at the front desk. All in all we had a lovely stay and would recommend the hotel to everyone. If I go back to Chicago again, this will be my number one choice

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny!”
Reviews.Author: frauw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many choice hotels in the past and I would have to say that I was disappointed in this one. The location is great! We only stayed one night as we were in Chicago to see a taping of the Oprah Winfrey Show. We got in about 10:30 at night and checked out at 6:40 the next morning so we spent very little time in the room. The room was one queen size bed and the room was not much wider than the bed. I have only seen rooms this tiny in Europe. I tried to book directly through the hotel but they would not take a reservation for only one night. I believe there was a convention or something. Therefore I booked through another website (ratestogo). It was the best deal I could find for the Magnicifient Mile in Chicago for that date. I believe the total came to $108 plus taxes. We parked in the recommended garage at $21 a night. However, you can only leave your car there until 12:00 noon the day of checkout. The guy working behind the counter let us leave our vehicle in the garage until 3 so we could shop a little after the taping and gave a different transponder to get the car out. You have to go outside the hotel to get to the garage. There was a tv in the room with cable but the picture was not even watchable. Since we were only there a few hours, it was not a big issue but was disappointing nonetheless. There is a continental breakfast served each morning starting at 7 am. Since we had to be at Harpo Studios by 7 a.m. (about $10 cab ride including tip from this hotel), I wasn't sure they would have anything set up. The gentleman in charge of breakfast had starting setting it up and my friend, myself and a business traveller were able to grab something to eat (muffins) but the beverages were not yet set out. I had previously stayed at the Raphael in March as it was cheaper but their parking (valet) is more expensive at $38. If I had it to do over again, I would stay at the Raphael, because the valet parking was worth it. The person I travelled with uses a motorized scooter and the valet parking would have been more convenient and the overall price would have been a couple of dollars cheaper. The Comfort Inn is in much better condition. than the Raphael as it has been recently remodeled and is very clean and also has a pool which I did not see. However, we had a much larger room and two double beds at the Raphael which made it more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: goravens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the Comfort Inn in August 05. This time we upgraded to a king which was much more spacious than the queen room we had stayed in the previous time. As before, everything was clean, updated and contemporary. The room was very comfortable and quiet, and staff was helpful. The continental breakfast was a definite bonus since we could eat on our way out in the morning and not have to worry about eating that meal out. The location is terrific - between State St. and Michigan Ave. - and close to the subway stop too. I have no complaints whatsoever, and the price is great for downtown Chicago and the added amenities of a jacuzzi and breakfast. Terrific stay all around.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel/excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fflyer
Reviews.Content: Location and apparent thorough recent renvovation makes this an excellent choice. The rooms, while not large, are huge by Euro standards. Everything appears new and sparkling. Breakfast, which is included, is well above average. This hotel will definitely be one of my choices when staying in Chicago LDF

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: jdf622
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel with a great location. Itâ€™s within 2 blocks of subway, great family restaurants and Michigan Avenue. Almost everything downtown is within walking distance. No need to rent a car if you are staying here. Good continental breakfast. Safes in room, fast elevators. Adequate hot tub, sauna and workout room. Friendly staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May, 2005 and we were immediately upgraded upon arrival. For a reasonable price, we had a very comfortable suite and the maid's service was exceptional. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful. From E. Ohio, you could just about walk to everything, including the California Pizza Kitchen. We bought a transport pass and used it occasionally on "The EL' and buses. For its location and price, the deal was very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Real Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the middle of everything. Price is reasonable. Nice hotel, great room for a family of five (separate room with a pullout couch), with free breakfast. Really in need of getting more shelf room in the bathroom and a few stains on the carpets. Parking is not real convenient. Accomodating staff. Nicely refurbished building. Otherwise, a great value for the area and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Option”
Reviews.Author: zzrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights July 16-20. 2 adults and 3 children ages 12-17. Very pleasant stay and very pleased with the entire experience. The high ratings are well deserved. I would stay here again. Location: Outstanding! Many great restaurants and attractions are within easy walking distance. We enjoyed Webers Grill, Pizzeria Uno, and Lawreys all within a block or two. Numerous other options available as well. Michigan Avenue and shopping very close. Close to transit service options. Hotel: Excellent. It was very clean, fresh art-deco styling. Parking garage $21/day with transponder to allow in/out access as desired. Room: Excellent. We stayed in a "magnificent double". The room had a wet bar, microwave, refrigerator, internet access (not wireless though), safe, coffee maker, iron, nice radio/CD/alarm. It was spacious for a non-suite room. Room for a roll-away bed, which was quite comfortable, not the typical bar-in-the-back style. The double beds were of satisfactory Serta quality. They were generous with their pillows which I found refreshing. The room was very clean and nicely lit. Our room was in the back of the building, which afforded no view at all, but was very quiet and free of street noise and lights. Amenities: Very good. The complimentary continental breakfasts were very nice, food was fresh. Coffee/tea available all the time. Fitness center is onsite, but we did not have time to utilize this. Sauna and whirlpool. No pool. Staff: Excellent. All were very friendly and helpul. They all seemed to smile. Some went out of their way to be of assistance without expecting anything in return. The few times we needed something (roll-away, extra towels, Yellowbook), someone brought them to our room within moments, no wait at all, the fastest service I've seen at any hotel ever. Price: Excellent. It is one of the least expensive options downtown, yet provides accomodations and service that could rival the much more expensive options. Negatives: very few. The air conditioning was weak, but then again it was around 96F every day. No view (but very quiet). A little hard to see the hotel sign from a distance (hotel is on the right side of this one way street). This is not an extravagant hotel, which makes it a very cost effective option. Those desiring a fancy hotel with extensive amenities would be disappointed. The service rivaled even the most expensive hotels I've stayed in. Those like us, looking for reasonable accomodations and a base from which to explore the attractions available in Chicago should be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites on Ohio St. in May 2005 for 4 days. One block from the El, 1/2 block from the Weber Grill Restaurant, on the line for the Pier Shuttle. The breakfast was excellent and lots of options available. Front desk was very helpful We never needed a taxi and toured everything. A great city and a very accomodating hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 24th - 30th and what a very pleasent stay it was. As other people have said a lot of the sites were within walking distance. I brought a $20 transit card and did not use it! I loved the Navy Pier and if you are looking for an alternative way of getting down to soldier feild and the feild museums then go by water taxi from the pier, $12 round trip and some good photo's to be taken from the boat of the skyline of Chicago. The staff were very freindly and helpfull If a light sleeper then maybe a higher floor and non street side might be better for you than my 5th floor street side (that did not bother me). Plenty of choice of what to eat from Mcdonalds to restaurants all within 5 -15 minute walk. I plan on going back to Chicago and will book here again. A very clean hotel in a superb location.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 15 E Ohio Street, Chicago, IL 60611
